title: LAKR vs SEA: Check our Dream 11 Prediction, Fantasy Cricket Tips, Playing Team Picks for Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6 on July 10th
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders will be up against Seattle Orcas in the 6th match of the Major League Cricket 2024 on Wednesday. Los Angeles Knight Riders have experienced mixed feelings at the start of the tournament with a win and a loss against Texas Super Kings and San Francisco Unicorns respectively. On the other hand, Seattle Orcas lost badly to MI New York in the tournament opener by 6 wickets.

Match Details:

Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Seattle Orcas, Match 6

Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Date & Time: July 10th at 6:00 AM IST and July 9th at 7:30 PM Local Time

Live Streaming: Sony Sports Network and JioCinema

What is the Pitch Report for LAKR vs SEA, Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6?

The surface produced middling scores in the last couple of matches. It’s a fast-paced wicket where seamers picked up the bulk of the wickets while spinners got a handful of them. Considering the recent scores anything more than 170 is a match-winning score here.

Recent form:

Los Angeles Knight Riders: Won, Lost, Won, Lost, Lost

Seattle Orcas: Lost, Lost, Won, Won, Lost

LAKR vs SEA, Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6 Probable Winners:

Seattle Orcas are expected to win this match.

What is the Expected, Probable Playing XIs for LAKR vs SEA, Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6?

Los Angeles Knight Riders

Jason Roy, Sunil Narine (c), Unmukt Chand (wk), Shakib Al Hasan, Nitish Kumar, David Miller, Andre Russell, Derone Davis, Corne Dry, Spencer Johnson, Ali Khan

Seattle Orcas

Quinton de Kock (wk), Nauman Anwar, Aaron Jones, Shubham Ranjane, Heinrich Klaasen (c), Imad Wasim, Michael Bracewell, Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Nandre Burger, Zaman Khan

Injury Updates:

Currently, the players from both squads are doing well and fit. It will be added when there is an update.

What are the Fantasy Cricket Top Picks, Players for LAKR vs SEA, Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6?

Top Pick – Batter

Jason Roy got back to form against Unicorns but that only limited to 26 runs, his knock comprised of 4 fours.

Top Pick – All-Rounder

Andre Russell doesn’t any introduction as he is a world-class all-rounder and the most decorated franchise player across the globe. In 2 matches in the tournament, he scored 50 runs at a strike rate of 166.66 and is yet to pick a wicket.

Top Pick – Bowler

Spencer Johnson got more purchase from the surface and bowled quick against Texas Super Kings and San Francisco Unicorns, picking up 5 wickets with the best figures of 3 for 36.

Top Pick – Wicketkeeper

Heinrich Klaasen is an excellent player of spin but only managed to find the deep mid-wicket fielder for just 5 runs against MI New York. He is expected to improve on his performances in this match.

X-Factor:

Shakib Al Hasan made decisive contributions for Knight Riders in the tournament, scoring 53 runs at a strike rate of 135.89 and picking up a wicket.

What are the Fantasy Suggested Teams for LAKR vs SEA, Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6?

1. Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen (vc), Jason Roy, Shubham Ranjane, Shakib Al Hasan, Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Cameron Gannon, Ali Khan, Spencer Johnson (c), Nandre Burger

2. Unmukt Chand, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Shubham Ranjane, Aaron Jones, Shakib Al Hasan (vc), Harmeet Singh, Sunil Narine (c), Andre Russell, Cameron Gannon, Spencer Johnson

Pre-Match Analysis:

Los Angeles Knight Riders who made a stunning comeback to hand Texas Super Kings a 12-run loss in their first game, failed to produce the same magic in the follow-up against San Francisco Unicorns and lost the match by 6 wickets with 28 balls to spare. Batting first they recovered well from 96 for 5 to post a target of 166, thanks to exceptional death batting from Andre Russell who added unbeaten 40* from 25 balls. In the defense, barring Spencer Johnson who claimed 3 wickets, the rest of the bowlers looked dull and the game slipped away from their hands quite easily. Will they get their mojo back against the Seattle Orcas? we need to wait and watch.
summary:
**Match Details**: The 6th match of the Major League Cricket 2024 will be played between Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas on July 10th at 6:00 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Teams' Recent Form**: Los Angeles Knight Riders have a mixed record with a win and a loss, while Seattle Orcas lost their opening match to MI New York.

**Pitch Report**: The pitch is expected to be fast-paced, with seamers likely to pick up most wickets and spinners getting a few. A score of over 170 is considered a match-winning total.

**Probable Winners**: Seattle Orcas are expected to win this match.

**Probable Playing XIs**: The article provides the expected playing elevens for both teams, including players like Jason Roy, Sunil Narine, Quinton de Kock, and Andre Russell.

**Fantasy Cricket Tips**: The article provides top picks for batters, all-rounders, bowlers, and wicketkeepers, as well as suggested fantasy teams and an X-factor player (Shakib Al Hasan).

**Pre-Match Analysis**: Los Angeles Knight Riders are looking to bounce back from their loss to San Francisco Unicorns, while Seattle Orcas aim to secure their first win of the tournament.

title: 'It was a big shock... wasn't my best self for some time': Unmukt Chand breaks silence on USA's T20 World Cup 2024 squad snub
body:
"That wasn't an ideal situation to be in. Because personally for me, this was what I had dreamed for the last three years. Obviously, it was a big shock. And it took me time to sort of come to terms with it. It's never easy as a player, having lost all those things back home in India, to have this one goal, which had kept me going for the last three years not happening," Unmukt said, as quoted by Cricbuzz, during the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

"So it is difficult. I won't say which just happened. But it was difficult. I was not my best self for some time," he added.

ALSO READ: Yusuf Pathan's 78-run knock in vain as Australia beat India by 23 runs; Dan Christian steals the show with 7 sixes to help Aussies qualify for semis

Trained in Maharashtra during T20 World Cup 2024

In Los Angeles Knight Riders’ first match of the season, he contributed with a 45-ball 68 in the win against Texas Super Kings. The Delhi-born batter revealed that he trained under his childhood coach in Maharashtra during the World Cup as co-hosts USA created history by beating Pakistan and progressed to Super 8 stage.

"That was a very internal battle and it's a sucker basically. It keeps sucking you inside and inside," he recalled.

ALSO READ: England announce playing XI for James Anderson's farewell Test vs West Indies at Lord's, Bairstow's replacement and KKR pacer to make debut

“That feeling would linger on for a day and then go away and then come back again. The reality would hit me in different phases. Once you keep going through that automatically you keep getting better. There comes a time when you're like it didn't happen, that's it. I'm not even thinking about it."

He will be seen in action when LA Knight Riders go up against Seattle Orcas at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on June 9.

MORE ON SPORTS TAK:

Rain stops Travis Head, Steve Smith's rampage as Texas Super Kings evade Washington Freedom's wrath after Faf du Plessis' 58-ball century
summary:
* Unmukt Chand, a player for the Los Angeles Knight Riders, has spoken about overcoming a personal setback, which he described as a "big shock" that took time to come to terms with.
* Despite this, he contributed to his team's win against the Texas Super Kings with a 45-ball 68 in their first match of the season.
* Chand revealed that he trained in Maharashtra during the T20 World Cup 2024, where the USA created history by beating Pakistan and progressing to the Super 8 stage.
* Chand will be seen in action again when the LA Knight Riders take on the Seattle Orcas at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on June 9.

title: "Was A Big Shock": India's U-19 World Cup Winning Captain Opens Up On USA Rejection
body:
Former India U-19 World Cup winning captain Unmukt Chand has opened up on his absence from USA's squad for the recently-concluded T20 World Cup. Chand took retirement from Indian cricket in 2021 before shifting base to the USA for better cricketing opportunities. After playing in the inaugural edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC), as well as other franchise tournaments, Chand became eligible to play for the USA. He had also expressed his wish of playing against India in the T20 World Cup, only to be left out of the squad.

Chand revealed that he was shocked after being left out of T20 World Cup squad, added that he had a feeling of being "sucked inside".

"That wasn't an ideal situation to be in. Because personally for me, this was what I had dreamed for the last three years. Obviously, it was a big shock. And it took me time to sort of come to terms with it. It's never easy as a player, having lost all those things back home in India, to having this one goal, which had kept me going for the last three years not happening. So it is difficult. I won't say which just happened. But it was difficult. I was not my best self for some time," Chand told Cricbuzz.

Chand also spoke about his inner demons and said that it took a lot of ups and downs to overcome that feeling.

"That was a very internal battle and it's a sucker basically. It keeps sucking you inside and inside. That feeling would linger on for a day and then go away and then come back again. The reality would hit me in different phases. Once you keep going through that automatically you keep getting better. There comes a time when you're like it didn't happen, that's it. I'm not even thinking about it," he added.

Chand, 31, has a point to prove, and started off the second season of Major League Cricket (MLC) - USA's franchise T20 league - with a swashbuckling half-century.

Interestingly, Chand's present MLC franchise is Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR), who are owned by the Knight Riders group. Many might remember that Chand's downfall started when he was famously clean bowled by Kolkata Knight Riders pacer Brett Lee in the opening ball of IPL 2013. He made 68 off 45 balls, hitting six 4s and three 6s.
summary:
* Unmukt Chand, a former India U-19 World Cup winning captain, played in the inaugural edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) and became eligible to play for the USA.
* Chand started off the second season of MLC with a swashbuckling half-century, scoring 68 off 45 balls, hitting six 4s and three 6s.
* He currently plays for the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) franchise, which is owned by the Knight Riders group.

title: West Indies will be 'Test match ready' while Proteas continue T20 schlep
body:
The West Indies begin a three-match Test series against England on Wednesday which, regardless of the outcome, will give them an advantage before the two Tests against the Proteas next month.

While the West Indies will be well up to speed with the Test format, by contrast, a large chunk of the 16 South African players named in the Test squad on Monday are either playing in the Major League Cricket T20 tournament in the US or not at all. Only David Bedingham, Wiaan Mulder and Matthew Breetzke are contracted on the county circuit.

At least that trio will have some first class matches under the belt and in Bedingham’s case, excellent form. Proteas coach Shukri Conrad said in a chat he had with Bedingham last week he told him to “save some runs for us”, after the 30-year-old surged to the top of the County Championship Division One run scorer’s list with an aggregate of 926 runs in 14 innings for Durham.

He has made five centuries and two half-centuries in that sequence, proving the decision to call him up for the Test squad last summer was overdue.

Bedingham’s form will be crucial, given he has rhythm in the longer format, something the MLC contracted players and those in South Africa will need to achieve through training camps and the sole warm-up match the squad will have in Trinidad before the first Test, which starts on August 7.

“We have the luxury of a warm-up game and we have 10 days in Trinidad before the first Test,” said Conrad.

Preparation for previous series against the West Indies and India last year were less than a week, so Conrad’s excitement about having 10 days is understandable.

“You have to roll with the punches, this is the modern world. I’m comfortable that guys in America can take the flight across and we have a week’s preparation before the first Test. It is what it is and we will make it work.”

The build-up to the first Test between the West Indies and England that starts at Lord’s on Wednesday has been dominated by Jimmy Anderson, who is playing his 188th and final Test. That has helped overshadow the threat the West Indies pose, particularly with the ball.

Though robbed of Kemar Roach, who was ruled out of the series with a knee injury, the West Indies still field a potent pace bowling trio in Jayden Seales, Alzarri Joseph and young sensation Shamar Joseph. The latter inspired the West Indies to their memorable victory over Australia in Brisbane earlier this year taking 7/68 in the second innings of that match.

“They have a nice [set] of fast bowlers and having won in Australia they will have added confidence,” said Conrad.

He had a first-hand look at Seales and Joseph last season when the pair toured South Africa with a West Indies A team, so there will be no surprises there. Much like England will have noted in their preparation, the West Indies’ batting isn’t as strong.

“There might be some frailties in the batting department that we can expose and exploit,” said Conrad.

The main frailty is inexperience. Among the batters, three haven’t played a Test, while three others — Kavem Hodge, Alick Athanaze and Kirk McKenzie — have a combined nine Tests between them.

They will be heavily reliant on captain Kraigg Brathwaite, former skipper Jason Holder, who wasn’t in Australia because he was contracted to the International League T20 in the UAE at the time, and wicketkeeper Joshua da Silva for their runs.
summary:
* A large chunk of South African players named in the Test squad are currently playing in the Major League Cricket (MLC) T20 tournament in the US.
* These players will need to adjust to the Test format quickly, as they will not have much preparation time before the two Tests against the West Indies next month.
* The MLC contracted players will have to rely on training camps and a sole warm-up match in Trinidad to get ready for the longer format.
* Coach Shukri Conrad is optimistic about the team's preparation, citing the luxury of a warm-up game and 10 days in Trinidad before the first Test.

title: Rickelton hits hundred on MLC debut
body:
Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock powered the Seattle Orcas to a nine-wicket win against the Los Angeles Knight Riders in Major League Cricket on Tuesday.

David Miller struck 44* off 22 balls (five fours, two sixes) to help LA post a competitive 168-5.

But it wasn’t enough as Rickelton smashed 103* off 66 balls (nine fours, five sixes) on his MLC debut, while De Kock contributed 51* off 46 balls (three fours, two sixes), to help Seattle win with a ball to spare.

It was a night to remember for Rickelton, who did not get a game for the Proteas at the recent T20 World Cup.
summary: In the Major League Cricket tournament, the Seattle Orcas defeated the Los Angeles Knight Riders by 9 wickets. LA Knight Riders scored 168-5, thanks to David Miller's 44* off 22 balls. However, Seattle Orcas chased down the target with a ball to spare, led by Ryan Rickelton's exceptional 103* off 66 balls on his MLC debut, and Quinton de Kock's 51* off 46 balls.

title: [Watch] Netravalkar Oozes Class With Wicket Of Centurion Faf Du Plessis In MLC 2024
body:
Faf du Plessis wicket by Saurabh Netravalkar (X.com)

Faf du Plessis is leading Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket 2024, and after failing in the first game, the man got his form back and smashed a century to take his team to a commendable total of 203.

He scored his century in just 46 balls, but could not carry on and in the penultimate over of the innings, Saurabh Netravalkar got the better of Faf du Plessis. It was a full delivery, outside off and Faf du Plessis danced down the track to play it over extra cover. He did not time it well though, and ended up hitting it left of Steve Smith, who grabbed a fine catch near the 30-yard circle.

Watch the wicket of Faf du Plessis -

However, the century went in vain as rain spoiled proceedings in the second half, and the match was called off after just four overs in which Washington Freedom smashed 62 runs.

Talking about Saurabh Netravalkar, he has been in good form since the T20 World Cup 2024. He was the 'Player of the Match' in the first game of the season for Washington Freedom where he picked three wickets while giving away just 24 runs in his four overs.
summary:
* The article is reporting on a match in the Major League Cricket 2024 tournament.
* Faf du Plessis is the captain of the Texas Super Kings team in the tournament.
* In the match, du Plessis scored a century in 46 balls, helping his team reach a total of 203.
* However, he was dismissed by Saurabh Netravalkar of Washington Freedom in the penultimate over of the innings.
* Unfortunately, the match was called off due to rain after just four overs of the second innings, with Washington Freedom scoring 62 runs.
* Saurabh Netravalkar has been in good form, having been named 'Player of the Match' in the first game of the season where he took three wickets for 24 runs in four overs.

title: LAKR vs SEO Match Prediction Who Will Win Today’s Match 6 Major League Cricket 2024
body:
The Match 6 of the Major League Cricket 2024 will see the clash between Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas on Wednesday, 10 July 2024. Keep reading to find out the LAKR vs SEO Match Prediction Match 6 Major League Cricket 2024.

Match Preview

In Match 4 of the Major League Cricket series, the San Francisco Unicorns emerged victorious against the Los Angeles Knight Riders. The Unicorns successfully chased down the target of 165/6 set by LAKR, finishing with 166/4 in just 15.2 overs. This six-wicket win underscored the Unicorns’ impressive performance and their ability to achieve a challenging target efficiently.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders put up a competitive score of 165/6 in their allotted 20 overs. Leading the charge, Andre Russell remained unbeaten with 40 runs off 25 balls. He was well-supported by Shakib Al Hasan, who contributed a steady 35 from 26 balls, and Jason Roy, who added a brisk 26 off 18 balls. On the bowling front, Spencer Johnson was the standout performer, taking 3 wickets for 36 runs in his 4 overs. Captain Sunil Narine also chipped in with 1 wicket for 39 runs in his 4 overs, while Russell bowled a highly economical over, conceding just 17 runs.

In the inaugural match of the Major League Cricket series, MI New York claimed a convincing victory over the Seattle Orcas. The Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs in 19.1 overs. MI New York efficiently chased the target, reaching 111/4 in 14.2 overs, and secured the win by 6 wickets, showcasing their strong batting lineup and effective bowling attack.

The Seattle Orcas struggled to build a substantial innings, being dismissed for 108 runs in 19.1 overs. Shubham Ranjane top-scored with 35 runs from 31 balls, followed by Harmeet Singh’s quick 20 off 14 deliveries and Aaron Jones’ 12 off 16 balls. title: WATCH: Andre Russell smacks his own stumps in MCL 2024
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) won their first match in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, edging out Texas Super Kings (TSK) by 12 runs at the Grand Prairie Stadium. The match witnessed a dramatic turn of events, with Andre Russell’s bizarre dismissal adding a touch of misfortune to the Knight Riders’ hard-fought victory.

LA Knight Riders sets competitive target

Batting first, the Knight Riders posted a commendable total of 162/7 in their 20 overs. Unmukt Chand anchored the innings with a well-composed 68 runs, while Nitish Kumar chipped in with a valuable 26. The Super Kings’ bowling attack, spearheaded by Zia-ul-Haq‘s economical spell of 2/16, did well to restrict the flow of runs.

Andre Russell’s bizarre dismissal

The turning point of the Knight Riders’ innings arrived in the 14th over. The big-hitting Dre Russ, known for his explosive batting, had a forgettable outing. Facing a yorker from Gerald Coetzee angling away from his body, Russell attempted a flick but ended up dislodging his own stumps with the bat while trying to play the shot. This comical yet crucial dismissal restricted him to a mere 10 runs off 5 deliveries.

Here’s the video:

Also WATCH: Derone Davis takes a screamer to dismiss Joshua Tromp in TSK vs LAKR game at MLC 2024

Ali Khan shines for LAKR

Despite Russell’s unfortunate exit, the Knight Riders bowlers rose to the occasion in the second innings. Right-arm pacer Ali Khan emerged as the hero, weaving a web of deception with his accurate fast bowling. His impressive spell of 4/33 put immense pressure on the Super Kings batters.

Chasing a target of 163, TSK started brightly with opener Devon Conway scoring a vital half-century (53 runs). However, the lack of substantial partnerships from other batters hampered their progress. The Knight Riders’ bowling attack, with Ali Khan leading the charge, maintained tight lines and lengths, stifling the Super Kings’ scoring rate. In the end, they fell short of the target by 12 runs, managing only 150/8 in their allotted 20 overs.
summary:
* Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) won their first match in MLC 2024 by defeating Texas Super Kings (TSK) by 12 runs at the Grand Prairie Stadium.
* LAKR set a competitive target of 163 runs, with Unmukt Chand scoring 68 and Nitish Kumar adding 26.
* Andre Russell was bizarrely dismissed for 10 runs, hitting his own stumps with the bat while trying to play a shot.
* In the second innings, LAKR bowler Ali Khan shone, taking 4/33 to restrict TSK's scoring rate.
* TSK opener Devon Conway scored a half-century (53), but the team fell short of the target, managing only 150/8 in 20 overs.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings get a point apiece after rain plays spoilsport
body:
Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings shared the honours after their match in Major League Cricket 2024 at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina on Monday had to be called off due to heavy rain.

Steve Smith and Travis Head had powered us to 62/0 in four overs after a rollicking start to the chase. Head hit two sixes and four fours in his unbeaten 32 off just 12 balls whereas Smith remained unconquered at 26 in only 13 balls striking three sixes and a boundary.

But rain had the final say as the game did not proceed further after four overs in the second innings.

Earlier, Faf du Plessis top-scored in the match with 100 off just 58 balls to guide TSK to 203/5 in 20 overs. Saurabh Netravalkar was the pick among our bowlers with a tidy spell of 2/33 in four overs.

Put into bat first, TSK got off to a good start reaching 67/0 at the end of the powerplay. Netravalkar broke the 109-run opening wicket partnership when he dismissed Devon Conway for 39, who was caught in the deep.

Akeal Hosein struck in the next over to bring us back in the contest as we got two wickets in the space of five runs and TSK were 114/2 after 12 overs. But Faf du Plessis and Marcus Stoinis added a quickfire 62 off just 29 balls to take TSK past the 150-run mark.

Netravalkar bowled an excellent penultimate over conceding just four runs including the wicket of centurion du Plessis as TSK finished at 203/5. Akeal Hosein, Marco Jansen and Justin Dill chipped in with a wicket each.

In response, our skipper Steve Smith started from where he left off in the last match hitting three sixes and a four to give us a flying start. Travis Head too joined the party plundering 22 runs in the fourth over as we raced to 62/0 in just four overs.

But rain played spoilsport as the match had to be called off and both teams got a point each since the mandatory five overs were not completed for the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method to be used.

With that, we moved to the top of the MLC 2024 points table with three points from two matches.

We are up against the Seattle Orcas in the next match on Thursday at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.
summary:
**Match Result:** The match between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings was called off due to heavy rain, with both teams sharing the points.

**First Innings:** Texas Super Kings scored 203/5 in 20 overs, with Faf du Plessis top-scoring with 100 off 58 balls. Saurabh Netravalkar was the pick of the Washington Freedom bowlers, taking 2/33 in four overs.

**Second Innings:** Washington Freedom were 62/0 in four overs, with Steve Smith scoring 26 off 13 balls and Travis Head scoring 32 off 12 balls, when the match was called off due to rain.

**Tournament Standings:** Washington Freedom moved to the top of the MLC 2024 points table with three points from two matches.

**Next Match:** Washington Freedom will play their next match against the Seattle Orcas on Thursday at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Preview
body:
This side of the Earth was just host to one of the most exciting World Cups in recent memory and now the eyes of the cricketing world will remain fixed on the US as Major League Cricket gets ready to fire up its second season.

Last year, it was Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, and MI New York that got to hoist the championship trophy in Texas. There's been a lot of player movement since last year and a lot of world-class cricketers will be playing in the league for the first time, but will anyone have the chops to dethrone MINY?

MI New York

The New Yorkers didn't do a lot of tinkering with the roster that took home the title. With a batting lineup that includes Pollard, Pooran, Dewald Brevis, and Tim David and a bowling attack that features Rashid, Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada, and the US's best spin bowler in Nosh Kenjige, there simply wasn't a whole lot to do. The biggest absentee from last year's squad is David Wiese. While Wiese spent the last month helping anchor Namibia's World Cup team, his time spent with MINY in 2023 wasn't as memorable. If anything, New York's bowling -- which was already one of the scariest in the league -- will get a boost from South African speedster Anrich Nortje, who spent last year with Washington.

With a roster very similar to the one that won it all last year, MINY will be the team to beat this year.

Seattle Orcas

The Orcas were the most consistent team in the league last year, taking a 5-1 record into the championship match. And, like MINY, they didn't do a lot of off-season roster movement. The team's core -- South Africans Heinrich Klaasan and Quinton de Kock, as well as Shayan Jayasuriya and Nauman Anwar (familiar names to fans of Minor League Cricket) -- remains intact.

Gone this year are Shimron Hetmyer and Andrew Tye. Seattle hopes to replace Hetmyer's bat -- though probably not his colorful hair -- with USA's Aaron Jones. Jones' 94 not out against Canada in the first match of the World Cup might be considered the spark that led the team to a berth in the Super Eights round. Making up Tye's lost overs will be South African Nandre Burger and West Indian Obed McCoy.

Look for the Orcas to make another strong run at the MLC title again this year.

Texas Super Kings

The Texas Super Kings wound up with the second-best record after the regular season, but back-to-back losses in the playoffs exposed the weaknesses that had haunted them throughout the campaign. Captain Faf du Plessis was abysmal as an opener and it seemed like they spent the early parts of every innings trying to claw back from a slow start.

So, what do you do? Well, if you're TSK, you clean house. Gone are the three of the team's top four run producers from last year -- Daniel Sams, David Miller, and Dwayne Bravo. And on the other side of the ball, gone are Gerald Coetzee and USA Cricket's Rusty Theron. That's a lot of runs and a lot of overs to make up.

Hoping to bring new life to the team and give TSK fans something to blow their whistles about are some big names: South African World Cup captain Aiden Markram, Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis, who played with San Francisco last year, and Afghanistan bowler Naveen ul-Haq. Another player to keep an eye on is 19-year-old Joshua Tromp, who lit up Minor League Cricket last year with the Houston Hurricanes.

If the new names come through, look for TSK to return to the playoffs. If they struggle, though, that's a lot of added pressure on captain Faf, Devon Conway, and domestic stars Milind Kumar and Calvin Savage.

Washington Freedom

The Freedom finished third in the league last year with a 3-2 record but were bounced in the first eliminator by the eventual champs, MINY. To make it back to the playoffs, Washington will have to deal with the departures of some big guns. Like TSK, they've seen the departure of three of their top four runs scorers from last year -- captain Moises Henriques, Matthew Short, and Glenn Phillips.

The team is in good shape, though, thanks to the addition of new captain, Australia's Steve Smith, New Zealand phenom Rachin Ravindra, and England's super solid Travis Head.

The Freedom's vicious bowling attack -- Marco Jansen, USA hero Saurabh Netravalkar, and West Indies spinner Akeal Hosein -- gets a boost from the addition of Lockie Ferguson. CricAmerica fave Dane Piedt won't be back with the team this year but look for some spin help from Amila Aponso and Akhilish Bodugum, who have both been impressive in minor league action.

San Francisco Unicorns

The Unicorns started the 2023 campaign strongly. They left the Dallas portion of the schedule with a 2-1 record but were never able to get on track in Morrisville. They lost back-to-back matches at Church Street Park to see their playoff hopes dashed.

There are lots of new faces on the team in 2024. Captain Aaron Finch has been replaced by Australian all-around-good-guy Pat Cummins. While retaining their top run scorer in USA's Corey Anderson, the Unicorns will have a lot of runs -- and overs -- to make up with the departures of Matthew Wade and all-rounders Marcus Stoinis and Shadab Khan.

Hoping to fill that void are 22-year-old Aussie Jake Fraser-McGurk, who had a breakout Indian Premier League season for the Dehli Capitals, Matthew Short, who led the Washington Freedom in scoring last year, and Sherfane Rutherford, who just about single-handedly took down New Zealand in a vital West Indies World Cup win.

This could be an interesting year for San Francisco. Pat Cummins knows how to win; he captained Australia to titles in both the most recent World Test Championship as well as the 2023 Cricket World Cup. If he can get the Unicorns going in right direction, they could be a playoff contender.

Los Angeles Knight Riders

No team had more flash and less success last year than the Knight Riders. With a batting lineup that included Andre Russell, Jason Roy, Rilee Rossouw, and Unmukt Chand and a bowling attack with two of the most creative spinners on the planet -- Sunil Narine and Adam Zampa -- as well as Lockie Ferguson and Ali Khan, they were beasts…on paper.

In reality, though, nothing clicked. They limped to a 1-4 record. And it wasn't even a pretty 1-4. They lost to TSK by 69 and got bowled out for 50 in a 105-run loss to MINY.

This year, they'll have to try it all again without Rossouw, who -- along with Russell -- was the only Knight Rider to crack 100 runs. Hoping to boost the offense is David Miller, who scored 143 for TSK last year and Bangladeshi all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan. Also gone for 2024 is New Zealand quick Ferguson but LA hopes to make up the difference with Josh Little, who's had success in The Hundred and was the first Irish player to sign with the IPL.

LAKR should be better than last year. Narine had a monster year for champions KKR in the IPL -- and West Indies fans can only wonder what would have happened if he was on the 2024 T20 World Cup team! If everyone else plays somewhat up to potential, the men in purple could make a run for the playoffs.

This season the Major League Cricket schedule is bumped up to seven matches for each team and games will -- once again -- be split between Grand Prairie Stadium outside of Dallas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina. Matches will be broadcast over the Willow cable channel and app with various regional sports networks bringing the action to those who don't have Willow.
summary:
**Defending Champions: MI New York**
MI New York won the championship trophy in Texas last year and is expected to be the team to beat this year, with a roster very similar to the one that won it all last year.

**Teams to Watch:**

* Seattle Orcas: Consistent team last year, with a strong core of players remaining intact, and new additions to replace Shimron Hetmyer and Andrew Tye.
* Texas Super Kings: After a disappointing playoff exit, TSK has made significant changes, bringing in big names like Aiden Markram, Marcus Stoinis, and Naveen ul-Haq to replace departed players.
* Washington Freedom: Despite losing key players, the addition of Steve Smith, Rachin Ravindra, and Lockie Ferguson strengthens the team's chances of returning to the playoffs.
* San Francisco Unicorns: With new captain Pat Cummins and additions like Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short, and Sherfane Rutherford, the Unicorns could be a playoff contender.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders: After a disappointing season last year, LAKR hopes to turn things around with the addition of David Miller, Shakib Al Hasan, and Josh Little.

**Tournament Format:**
Each team will play seven matches, with games split between Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina. Matches will be broadcast on the Willow cable channel and app, as well as various regional sports networks.

title: Texas Super Kings vs. MI New York | How to watch
body:
GRAND PRAIRIE, Texas — The Major League Cricket regular season has wrapped up, and the Texas Super Kings have made the playoffs and will play MI New York in the "Eliminator match."

San Francisco and Washington Freedom led the way with 11 points each. Texas Super Kings came in third place with eight points and MI New York advanced to the playoffs with five points.

The entire playoffs of Major League Cricket will be played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, one of the two venues used by the league for the 2024 season. The Texas Super Kings will take on MI New York on Wednesday, July 24 at 7:30 p.m. CT.

The winner of the Eliminator match will take on the loser of the "Qualifier match" – San Francisco vs. Washington Freedom – in the "Challenger match." The Qualifier match will take place on Friday, July 26 at 7:30 p.m. CT.

Texas Super Kings vs. MI New York | How to watch

TV / streaming:

USA: Willow by Cricbuzz, YES Network, Monumental Sports Network, Bally Sports LA, Bally Sports Southwest, Root Sports Northwest

India Television: Sony Sports Network

India Digital Streaming: JioCinema

Caribbean: ESPN

Canada: Willow by Cricbuzz

UK and Ireland: TNT Sports

Sub-Saharan Africa: ESPN

Pakistan: A Sports

Middle East and North Africa: Cricbuzz

Australia and New Zealand: Prime Video

The winner of the Qualifier match advances straight to the Championship match. MI New York are the defending Major League Cricket champions after beating the Seattle Orcas last season. Each season, MI New York has been the No. 4 seed in the playoffs.

Tickets for the playoff matches are available online here.
summary: The Major League Cricket regular season has ended, and the playoffs are set to begin. The Texas Super Kings have qualified for the playoffs and will face MI New York in the "Eliminator match" on July 24 at 7:30 p.m. CT at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. The winners of the Eliminator match will advance to the "Challenger match" against the loser of the "Qualifier match" between San Francisco and Washington Freedom, which will take place on July 26. The winner of the Qualifier match will directly advance to the Championship match. MI New York is the defending champion and has been the No. 4 seed in the playoffs every season. All playoff matches will be played at Grand Prairie Stadium, and tickets are available online.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Texas Super Kings Eliminate Mi New York To Cruise Into Challenger Clash
body:
The Texas Super Kings dominated the defending champions, MI New York, in a crucial eliminator match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket. With a comprehensive 9-wicket victory, TSK secured their spot in the challenger on July 26, while MI New York’s tournament journey came to an end. (More Cricket News)

Set a target of 164, TSK's openers Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway laid a solid foundation. Du Plessis was in good form, smashing 72 off 47 balls - including six boundaries and three sixes. The duo put on a strong 101-run opening stand.

Devon Conway took a backseat initially, allowing captain Faf du Plessis to do his magic. However, after du Plessis' dismissal, Conway took the charge. Anchoring the innings with a steady 50* off 42 balls, he put up foundation for a dominant chase.

Joining Conway, Aaron Hardie unleashed a blistering cameo of 34* from just 20 balls. The duo ensured there was no late hiccup as TSK cantered to victory, reaching the target of 167 with nine wickets in hand and 7.3 overs to spare. Hardie's boundary sealed the deal, capping off a good game by the Super Kings.

Earlier, MI New York got off to a shaky start before Shayan Jahangir and Monank Patel gave a stable game with a 49-run partnership.

However, bowling from Texas Super Kings kept the scoring in check. Patel headed the innings with a good 48, but it was Rashid Khan's explosive 55 that lifted MI New York to a good total.
summary:
**Match Result:** Texas Super Kings (TSK) won against MI New York by 9 wickets in an eliminator match.

**TSK's Performance:** Openers Faf du Plessis (72 off 47 balls) and Devon Conway (50* off 42 balls) laid a solid foundation with a 101-run opening stand. Aaron Hardie contributed with a quick 34* off 20 balls to ensure a comfortable chase.

**MI New York's Performance:** Shayan Jahangir and Monank Patel stabilized the innings with a 49-run partnership. Monank Patel scored 48, while Rashid Khan's explosive 55 helped MI New York reach a respectable total of 164.

**Consequences:** TSK secured their spot in the challenger on July 26, while MI New York's tournament journey came to an end.

title: San Francisco Unicorns Secure Victory Against Washington Freedom in Major League Cricket Match
body:
The San Francisco Unicorns, led by Sanjay Krishnamurthi and Josh Inglis, emerged victorious against the Washington Freedom in match 20 of Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. Krishnamurthi scored an unbeaten 79 off 42 balls, while Inglis contributed 45 runs off 17 balls, securing a six-wicket win for the Unicorns despite the Washington Freedom's strong start led by Australians Steve Smith and Travis Head.

By the Numbers

Sanjay Krishnamurthi scored an unbeaten 79 off 42 balls.

Josh Inglis hit 45 runs off just 17 balls.

State of Play

San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom both concluded the season with 11 points from seven matches.

Washington Freedom finished first due to a higher net run rate, with San Francisco in the second spot.

Due to rain, the San Francisco Unicorns were set a DLS-adjusted target of 177 runs in 14 overs.

What's Next

Future matches will test the mettle of both teams as they aim for continued success in Major League Cricket 2024.

Bottom Line

The San Francisco Unicorns' strategic batting by Krishnamurthi and Inglis propelled them to a crucial victory over the Washington Freedom, showcasing resilience and skill in the face of tough competition.
summary: The San Francisco Unicorns defeated the Washington Freedom in match 20 of Major League Cricket 2024, winning by 6 wickets. Sanjay Krishnamurthi scored an unbeaten 79 off 42 balls, and Josh Inglis contributed 45 runs off 17 balls. Despite a strong start by the Washington Freedom, led by Steve Smith and Travis Head, the Unicorns secured the win, reaching a DLS-adjusted target of 177 runs in 14 overs. The match concluded the season for both teams, with the Washington Freedom finishing first due to a higher net run rate and the San Francisco Unicorns finishing second, both teams earning 11 points from seven matches.

title: Texas Super Kings eliminate MI New York to secure spot in challenger clash
body:
In the critical eliminator match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket, the Texas Super Kings (TSK) delivered a near-perfect performance, defeating defending champions MI New York (MINY) with a commanding 9-wicket victory.

Match Summary

Texas Super Kings vs MI New York, Eliminator

Texas Super Kings 167/1 (18.3 ov)

MI New York 163/8 (20 ov)

Texas Super Kings won by 9 wickets

SCORECARD

Runrate

Match Analysis

This win secured TSK's place in the challenger on July 26 and ended MI New York's campaign in the tournament.

Set a target of 164, TSK's openers Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway laid a solid foundation. Du Plessis was in sublime form, smashing 72 off 47 balls, including six boundaries and three sixes. The duo put on a 101-run opening stand, effectively nullifying any hopes MI New York had of defending their total.

Conway let his skipper take charge, but after du Plessis was dismissed by Nosthush Kenjige, he took up the mantle with a steady 50* off 42 balls. Aaron Hardie joined Conway and continued the onslaught. Hardie’s quickfire 34* off 20 balls ensured that there was no late drama as TSK reached the target comfortably, finishing at 167/1 in just 18.3 overs. The win was sealed with a boundary from Hardie, capping off a dominant performance by the Super Kings.

Earlier in the day, MI New York's innings got off to a rocky start after electing to bat first. Dewald Brevis fell for a duck in the very first over, caught by Stoinis off Zia-ul-Haq. Nicholas Pooran soon followed suit, managing just 8 runs before falling to Marcus Stoinis. At 3/2, MINY were in a dire situation.

Shayan Jahangir (26) and Monank Patel (48) attempted to stabilize the innings with a 49-run partnership. However, the scoring rate was kept in check by disciplined bowling from TSK. Patel's patient knock of 48 off 41 balls included five boundaries and a six, but it was Rashid Khan who provided the much-needed acceleration. Rashid's blistering 55 off 30 balls, featuring four sixes and four boundaries, propelled MINY to a respectable total.

Despite Rashid's heroics, TSK bowlers ensured that MINY couldn't run away with the game. Marcus Stoinis was the pick of the bowlers, finishing with his two wickets while also conceding just 18 runs, while Noor Ahmad chipped in with 1/37 from his four overs.

Match Stats

MI New York Fall of wickets: 1-0 (Dewald Brevis - 0.4 ov), 2-18 (Nicholas Pooran - 3.4 ov), 3-67 (Shayan Jahangir - 10.1 ov), 4-102 (Monank Patel - 14.1 ov), 5-155 (Rashid Khan - 18.5 ov), 6-162 (Kieron Pollard - 19.4 ov), 7-162 (Heath Richards - 19.5 ov), 8-163 (Trent Boult - 19.6 ov)

Texas Super Kings Fall of wickets: 1-101 (Faf du Plessis - 12.3 ov)

* Devon Conway (TSK): 50* off 42 balls

**Match Summary:** TSK's openers, Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway, laid a solid foundation, putting on a 101-run opening stand. After du Plessis' dismissal, Conway and Aaron Hardie continued the onslaught, ensuring a comfortable 9-wicket victory for TSK. This win secured TSK's place in the challenger on July 26 and ended MI New York's campaign in the tournament.

title: Injured Coetzee out of South Africa's Test series against West Indies
body:
(Web Desk) – South Africa suffered a blow as fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of upcoming Test series against the West Indies because of a side strain.

He will be replaced by Migael Pretorius, uncapped at Test level but with the experience of 64 first-class games to his credit.

He strained his left side during the USA's T20 franchise league, Major League Cricket (MLC).

Coetzee, playing for Texas Super Kings, returned home to undergo assessments by the medical team. Cricket South Africa confirmed on Thursday that he was not adjudged fit to play the Test series starting on August 7.

Pretorius was last named in a South Africa squad in March 2021, for a T20I series against Pakistan, but he didn't get a cap. He also got a call in December 2020 for a Test series in Sri Lanka, but then injured his shoulder and could not debut.

Pretorius, 29, has grabbed 188 wickets at 27.50 in 64 first-class games. He is currently the leading wicket-taker for Somerset in this season's English County Championship, with 23 wickets.

South Africa kick off the Test series in Port-of-Spain, before moving to Providence for the second Test. Three T20Is follow, from August 24 to 28.

The Test squad

Temba Bavuma (capt), David Bedingham, Matthew Breetzke, Nandre Burger, Tony de Zorzi, Keshav Maharaj, Aiden Markram, Wiaan Mulder, Lungi Ngidi, Dane Paterson, Dane Piedt, Kagiso Rabada, Tristan Stubbs, Ryan Rickelton, Kyle Verreynne, Migael Pretorius. – Courtesy ESPNcrcinfo
summary:
* Gerald Coetzee, a South African fast bowler, suffered a side strain while playing for Texas Super Kings in the USA's T20 franchise league, Major League Cricket (MLC).

That's the only relevant information about the Major League Cricket tournament mentioned in the article.

title: Migael Pretorius replaces Coetzee in Test squad against West Indies
body:
On July 25 (Thursday), Cricket South Africa (CSA) announced that pacer Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of the two-match Test series against West Indies with a left side strain. Pacer Migael Pretorius replaces Coetzee in the squad, his second call-up since December 2020 against Sri Lanka.

Coetzee sustained the injury during his stint with Texas Super Kings at the Major League Cricket (MLC) in America. He then returned home and underwent further assessments by the Proteas medical team and has subsequently not been medically cleared to take part in the tour.

Pretorious, on the other hand, was rewarded for his 23-wicket season for Somerset in the ongoing County Championship, with an overall first-class tally of 188 wickets.

Proteas Test squad against West Indies:

Temba Bavuma (captain), David Bedingham, Matthew Breetzke, Nandre Burger, Tony de Zorzi, Keshav Maharaj, Aiden Markram, Wiaan Mulder, Lungi Ngidi, Dane Paterson, Dane Piedt, Migael Pretorius, Kagiso Rabada, Ryan Rickelton, Tristan Stubbs, Kyle Verreynne
summary:
* Gerald Coetzee, a player in the MLC, sustained a left side strain during his stint with Texas Super Kings in the tournament.
* This injury has ruled him out of the two-match Test series against West Indies.

No other information about the MLC tournament is mentioned in the article.

title: NY vs TEX Match Prediction – Who will win today’s MLC match between New York vs Texas?
body:
The league-stage has now concluded, and the attention turns to the forthcoming Eliminator, where the MI New York (NY) will face off against the Texas Super Kings (TEX) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas in Match 22 of Major League Cricket 2024.

NY narrowly secured a place in the playoffs, achieving this by the slimmest of margins. In their final group-stage encounter, they faced a must-win circumstance and ultimately prevailed against the Los Angeles Knight Riders, thereby just managing to advance to the knockout stages after winning only a couple of games throughout their campaign.

title: [Watch] Rashid Khan Recreates Iconic ABD And MSD Shots During Blistering Fifty In MLC 2024
body:
Rashid Khan recreated ABD's famous shot [X]

Afghanistan's legendary cricketer Rashid Khan showcased his all-round prowess for the umpteenth time in MI New York's eliminator encounter against Texas Super Kings (TSK) in the ongoing Major League Cricket.

On Thursday, Faf du Plessis-led TSK swatted aside MI New York by nine wickets to book a berth in qualifier 2.

However, amid MI's disappointing performance, the in-form Rashid Khan stood out, hammering a belligerent 55-run knock to bail his side out of trouble.

Watch- Rashid shows glimpses of ABD in MLC 2024

After being put into bat first, MI New York had a shaky start, losing key wickets of Dewald Brevis, Nicholas Pooran and Shayan Jahangir inside 11 overs.

However, MI's decision to promote Rashid Khan up the order proved to be a masterstroke, as he struck 55 runs to power them to a respectable total.

He took a particular liking for his national teammate Noor Ahmad, smashing him disdainfully all around the park.

He took only 30 balls to compose his blistering knock, studded with four boundaries and as many sixes.

Although he played several delightful shots, his outrageous aerial guide over the backward point and a helicopter shot mesmerised everyone, reminding the fans of AB de Villiers and MS Dhoni.

Besides putting up a memorable batting show, Rashid also had a good day with the ball, conceding 22 runs off his four overs.

However, his valiant allround effort went in vain, with TSK chasing the 164-run target easily, riding on clinical fifties from Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis.
summary:
* The article reports on a match in the eliminator round of the Major League Cricket tournament between MI New York and Texas Super Kings (TSK).
* TSK won the match by 9 wickets, with Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis scoring clinical fifties, to book a berth in Qualifier 2.
* Rashid Khan, playing for MI New York, had a notable performance, scoring 55 runs off 30 balls, including 4 boundaries and 4 sixes, to help his team reach a respectable total of 164.
* Despite Rashid's all-round effort, including conceding 22 runs off his 4 overs, MI New York lost the match.

title: Proteas lose quickie Coetzee for Windies Test series, uncapped Pretorius roped in as cover
body:
The Proteas have lost the services of fast bowler Gerald Coetzee for next month's two-Test series against the West Indies in the Caribbean.

READ | Red-hot Breetzke realises Test cricket dream with Proteas call-up: 'I'm hungry to learn'

Cricket South Africa announced on Thursday that Coetzee is laid low by a left side strain. The 23-year-old sustained the injury while playing for Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket in the United States earlier this month.

Further assessments by the Proteas medical team deemed the player unfit for the tour.

North West Dragons quickie Migael Pretorius has been named as Coetzee's replacement.

The uncapped Pretorius returns to the SA Test setup for the first time since his maiden call-up in December 2020 against Sri Lanka. The 29-year-old is yet to make his Test debut though.

Pretorius boasts 188 first class wickets, with his most recent red-ball outings seeing him bag 23 wickets in eight matches for Somerset in the ongoing English County Championship.
summary: Gerald Coetzee, a 23-year-old fast bowler, sustained a left side strain while playing for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket tournament in the United States earlier this month. The injury has ruled him out of the upcoming two-Test series against the West Indies in the Caribbean.

title: Gerald Coetzee ruled out of West Indies Test series following left side strain
body:
South Africa's cricket team has suffered a major setback as their rising fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of the upcoming two-match Test series against the West Indies scheduled for next month.

The 23-year-old speedster sustained a left side strain while participating in the Major League Cricket for Texas Super Kings earlier this month, forcing him to withdraw from the crucial tour.

The Proteas, looking to maintain their form in Test cricket, have acted swiftly to fill the void left by Coetzee's absence. North-West Dragons fast bowler Migael Pretorius has been called up as his replacement, marking the 29-year-old's return to the Test setup after nearly four years.

Coetzee's injury comes as a disappointment for both the player and the team. The young quick has been making rounds in international cricket, and this series was seen as another opportunity for him to hold his place in the Proteas' bowling attack.

Upon returning home from the MLC, Coetzee underwent thorough assessments by the Proteas medical team, who ultimately decided against clearing him for the Caribbean tour.

Also read: Matthew Breetzke earns maiden Test call-up for West Indies series, Marco Jansen, Anrich Nortje misses

South Africa to play in two-match Test series

Pretorius who is yet to make his Test debut, brings a wealth of first-class experience to the squad. With 188 wickets in his overall first-class career, he has shown his ability to perform consistently in the longer format. In his recent stint in England's County Championship, he claimed 23 wickets in eight matches for Somerset.

This call-up represents a second chance for Pretorius to break into the Test setup. His first inclusion in the Test squad came in December 2020 for the series against Sri Lanka, though he didn't make his debut then. Now, with Coetzee sidelined, Pretorius has a golden opportunity to step out on the field as Test cricketer.

The two-match Test series against the West Indies is scheduled to begin on August 7th at Queen's Park Oval in Trinidad and Tobago, followed by the second Test at Guyana National Stadium, starting on August 15th. Before the series, South Africa will play a warm-up match against a West Indies Invitational XI from July 31st to August 3rd at the Brian Lara Cricket Academy.

Also read: Scotland's Charlie Cassell breaks Kagiso Rabada's record for best figures on ODI debut

Temba Bavuma (captain), David Bedingham, Matthew Breetzke, Nandre Burger, Tony de Zorzi, Keshav Maharaj, Aiden Markram, Wiaan Mulder, Lungi Ngidi, Dane Paterson, Dane Piedt, Migael Pretorius, Kagiso Rabada, Ryan Rickelton, Tristan Stubbs, and Kyle Verreynne.

* Gerald Coetzee, a 23-year-old South African fast bowler, sustained a left side strain while participating in the MLC for Texas Super Kings earlier this month.

body:
Proteas fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of next month’s two-match Test series against the West Indies.

The 23-year-old sustained a left side strain while playing for the Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket earlier this month.

He returned home and underwent further assessments by the Proteas medical team and has subsequently not been medically cleared to take part in the tour.

title: MLC 2024 [WATCH]: Rashid Khan plays a remarkable innovative shot for six in the TSK vs MINY Eliminator game
body:
Afghanistan’s star all-rounder, Rashid Khan, illuminated the crowd at the Grand Prairie Stadium with a scintillating half-century for MI New York in their Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 Eliminator clash against the Texas Super Kings.

Rashid, batting higher in the order than usual, unleashed a barrage of powerful strokes during his 30-ball innings, amassing 55 runs. His explosive performance included a standout moment with an innovative shot that featured prominently in the highlights of the New York innings, which concluded at 163/8 in their 20 overs.

Rashid Khan’s unique stroke play

Rashid is well-known for his ability to replicate MS Dhoni’s signature ‘helicopter’ shot, a swift aerial flick from near the off-stump to the on-side, often resulting in a six. However during the match, Rashid introduced a unique shot of himself.

Facing a delivery from pacer Aaron Hardie, Rashid innovatively adjusted his approach. On the last ball of the 17th over, with a delivery marginally short and outside off-stump, Rashid sat deep in his crease and, with a powerful whip of his bat, sent the ball soaring over wide long-on for a spectacular six.

Here’s the video:

Also READ: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Broadcast, live streaming details – When and Where to watch in India, US, UK, Australia & other countries

MI New York’s challenging start

New York’s innings got off to a rocky start after being asked to bat first by TSK. They lost opener Dewald Brevis for a duck and Nicholas Pooran for 8, both wickets falling inside the first four overs, leaving the team at a precarious 18 for 2.

Shayan Jahangir and Monank Patel then steadied the innings with a 39-run partnership before Dwayne Bravo disrupted it by dismissing Jahangir for 26 off 23 balls. Rashid then joined Patel, and although the duo added a promising 35 runs, Patel was dismissed by spinner Noor Ahmad for a well-made 48 off 41 balls.

Rashid’s impactful innings

Despite the interruptions, Rashid’s innings proved crucial. He counter-attacked with flair, hitting Bravo and Noor for boundaries, and scored two consecutive sixes off Hardie. His aggressive batting helped elevate the score to a competitive 163, though Romario Shepherd and New York’s captain, Kieron Pollard, contributed modestly. Rashid’s innings, characterized by 4 fours and 4 sixes, came at an impressive strike rate of 183.33. It marked the fourth time he has scored a fifty in T20 cricket.

Victory for the Texas Super Kings

In the second innings, despite a brief rain delay complicating conditions, Rashid delivered a disciplined spell of bowling. He was introduced in the fourth over and conceded only four runs. Over his four-over spell, he maintained tight control, giving away just 22 runs.

Nevertheless, despite Rashid’s efforts, the Texas Kings chased down the target with ease. The leading run-scorer of the tournament, Faf du Plessis, continued his exceptional form, scoring another fifty and guiding TSK to a nine-wicket victory, thus winning the crucial Eliminator game.
summary:
**Match Details:** The article reports on the MLC 2024 Eliminator clash between MI New York and Texas Super Kings at the Grand Prairie Stadium.

**Rashid Khan's Performance:** Afghanistan's star all-rounder Rashid Khan played a crucial role in the match, scoring a scintillating half-century (55 runs off 30 balls) for MI New York. His innings included 4 fours and 4 sixes at an impressive strike rate of 183.33. Rashid also introduced a unique shot, hitting a six over wide long-on with a powerful whip of his bat.

**MI New York's Innings:** After a challenging start, losing two wickets early, MI New York recovered thanks to a 39-run partnership between Shayan Jahangir and Monank Patel. Rashid's aggressive batting then helped elevate the score to a competitive 163/8 in 20 overs.

**Result:** Despite Rashid's efforts, the Texas Super Kings chased down the target with ease, winning the Eliminator game by 9 wickets. Faf du Plessis, the leading run-scorer of the tournament, continued his exceptional form, scoring another fifty to guide TSK to victory.

title: South African pacer Gerald Coetzee ruled out of the Test series against West Indies; replacement announced
body:
South African cricket has received a setback with the news that promising fast bowler Gerald Coetzee will miss the upcoming two-Test series against the West Indies. The pacer has been ruled out due to a side strain, an injury sustained during his stint with the Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

Coetzee had been making significant strides in his Test career and his absence will undoubtedly be felt by the Proteas. The young pacer’s ability to generate pace and bounce made him a valuable asset to the team, and his unavailability is a significant blow to South Africa’s bowling attack.

Replacement announced

In a bid to bolster their pace bowling options, South Africa have called up Migael Pretorius, uncapped at Test level, as Coetzee’s replacement. The bowling all-rounder brings a wealth of first class cricket experience and versatility to the side, capable of contributing both with the bat and the ball.

Pretorius’ inclusion adds depth to the Proteas squad and provides a viable option for the team management. While he may not be a like-for-like replacement for Coetzee, his ability to contribute in multiple facets of the game makes him a valuable asset.

Also READ: South African coach Rob Walter opens up on Quinton de Kock’s T20I future

Impact on the series

Coetzee’s absence is a significant setback for South Africa, especially considering the challenging conditions that await them in the West Indies. The Caribbean pitches are known to offer assistance to fast bowlers, and Coetzee’s ability to extract bounce would have been crucial.

The Proteas will now have to rely on their remaining pace bowlers to shoulder the burden. Kagiso Rabada, and Lungi Ngidi will be expected to lead the attack, with Pretorius providing support.

Temba Bavuma (captain), David Bedingham, Matthew Breetzke, Nandre Burger, Tony de Zorzi, Keshav Maharaj, Aiden Markram, Wiaan Mulder, Lungi Ngidi, Dane Paterson, Dane Piedt, Kagiso Rabada, Tristan Stubbs, Ryan Rickelton, Kyle Verreynne, Migael Pretorius.
summary:
* Gerald Coetzee, a South African fast bowler, sustained a side strain injury during his stint with the Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.
* This injury has ruled him out of the upcoming two-Test series against the West Indies.

title: Top 3 India-Born Cricketers In MLC 2024 Playoffs
body:
The cricket system in the USA, similar to in different parts of the world, isn’t always without its flaws. Although it represents a vast emerging marketplace for the game, its early years were marred by controversies. Despite these challenges, one positive development has been the establishment of Major League Cricket (MLC), a premier T20 competition.

MLC has created a platform for players from diverse countries and backgrounds to interact with some of the sport’s biggest names. This league provides an indirect pathway for Indian cricketers, who are unable to play outside of India, to showcase their talents if they relocate to the USA for various reasons.

As MLC 2024 approaches the qualifiers, three Indian-born players are particularly keen to make their mark. Let’s take a closer look at their stories:

1. Milind Kumar – Texas Super Kings

Right-handed batsman Milind Kumar was once quite a celebrity in Indian domestic cricket. He began his career in the Ranji Trophy with his hometown Delhi before moving to Sikkim for the 2018-19 season, where he emerged as the highest run-scorer with 1331 runs beating the top players as the faces of Wasim Jaffer and Rinku Singh .

Kumar had brief spells in the Indian Premier League (IPL) with Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) and Royal Challengers Bangalore. However, limited opportunities led him to move to the USA around 2021, where he initially played in Minor League Cricket. His impressive performances there earned him a spot in the Texas Super Kings (TSK) for the inaugural MLC season. Kumar has since secured his place in the team, regularly batting at number five under the leadership of Faf du Plessis.

This season, Kumar contributed to TSK’s third-place finish in the league stage. His early matches included a couple of unbeaten innings, though he didn’t have much to bat in those games. He later scored two runs each in two consecutive matches before making a decent 29 (28) against the Seattle Orcas just before the playoffs.

2. Monank Patel – MI New York

Monank Patel is a well-known figure as the captain of the USA national team, which he led commendably during the recent 2024 T20 World Cup, including scoring a half-century against Pakistan. Born in Anand, Gujarat, Patel moved to the USA permanently in 2016 to open a restaurant in New Jersey, having earned his green card in 2010.

Although Patel played only age-group cricket in Gujarat, his cricketing development primarily occurred in the USA, leading to his international debut in 2018. As a keeper-batsman, he has struggled to replicate his international form in MLC.

Last season, he managed just 63 runs, and in the current edition, apart from a notable 61-run inning against TSK in a losing effort, he has not surpassed eight runs in six other games. However, his potential to shine in critical matches might still come through as MLC progresses.

3. Saurabh Netravalkar – Washington Freedom

The journey of Saurabh Netravalkar is one of the most famous stories in Indian cricket teams. Born in Mumbai in 1991, the leading wicket-taker in the 2010 Under-19 World Cup is a promising left-arm spinner. Netrawalkar moved to the US. in 2015 to pursue a career in software engineering but continued his passion for cricket, which ultimately led to his international debut for the US

In MLC 2024, Netra Valkar has confirmed her growing popularity. Despite missing two matches due to the birth of a child, he picked up 12 wickets in five games, making him the top wicket-taker in the tournament and his performances, especially in the powerplay, have been significant in the Washington Freedom victory, helping them gain the top spot in the league table.

Although he went wicketless against the San Francisco Unicorns in a recent match, he is expected to bounce back strongly in the upcoming qualifier against the same team. These three players highlight the opportunities MLC provides for cricketers with diverse backgrounds and journeys, fostering a unique cricketing ecosystem in the USA.
summary:
The article highlights the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament, a premier T20 competition in the USA, and its significance in providing a platform for players from diverse countries and backgrounds to showcase their talents. The article focuses on three Indian-born players who are part of the MLC: Milind Kumar, Monank Patel, and Saurabh Netravalkar.

* Milind Kumar, a right-handed batsman, plays for the Texas Super Kings (TSK) and has secured his place in the team, regularly batting at number five.
* Monank Patel, the captain of the USA national team, plays for MI New York and has struggled to replicate his international form in MLC, but has shown potential to shine in critical matches.
* Saurabh Netravalkar, a left-arm spinner, plays for the Washington Freedom and has been the top wicket-taker in the tournament, picking up 12 wickets in five games.

The article concludes by highlighting the opportunities MLC provides for cricketers with diverse backgrounds and journeys, fostering a unique cricketing ecosystem in the USA.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Hindi: क्रिकेटर राशिद खान ने अमेरिका में रचा इतिहास, राशिद खान ने अपनी टीम को क्वालीफाई कराने में निभाई अहम भूमिका
body:
Major League Cricket 2024 Hindi: अमेरिका में एमएलसी 2024 का दूसरा टूर्नामेंट खेला जा रहा है जहाँ पहले संस्करण की चैंपियन टीम एमआई न्युयोर्क ने बमुश्किल क्वालीफाई किया है जिसमें अफगानिस्तान के स्टार खिलाड़ी राशिद खान जो एमआई न्यूयोर्क के लिए एमएलसी में खेल रहे है जिन्होंने अपनी बेहतरीन गेंदबाज़ी से अपनी टीम को सुपर 4 में क्वालीफाई कराया है।

जी हाँ एमएलसी सीज़न 2 का 19वां मैच 21 जुलाई को एमआई न्यूयोर्क और लॉस एंजल्स के बीच खेला गया जहाँ एमआई न्यूयोर्क ने टॉस जीतकर पहले गेंदबाज़ी करने का फैसला किया जहाँ लॉस एंजल्स ने पहले बल्लेबज़ी करते हुए 130/10 रनो का स्कोर ही खड़ा कर पाई थी जबकि आख़िरी ओवर की 5 गेंद शेष रह गई थी। लॉस एंजल्स नाईट राइडर और एमआई न्यूयोर्क ने अपने 7 मैच खेले जिसमें लॉस एंजल्स ने 2 मैच जीते वाही एमआई न्यूयोर्क ने भी दो मैच जीते लेकिन अच्छे रन रेट होने की वजह से टीम एमआई न्यूयोर्क क्वालीफाई कर चुकी है।

MLC पॉइंट्स टेबल इन हिंदी

2023 की चैंपियन टीम ने की वापसी

एमएलसी टूर्नामेंट 2024 में एमआई न्यूयोर्क टीम का प्रदर्शन बहुत निराशाजनक रहा है जबकि एमआई न्यूयोर्क पहली चैंपियन रह चुकी है उन्होंने हालांकि बहुत उम्दा अंदाज़ में वापसी की है। एमआई अपने रन रेट बेहतर होने की वजह से क्वालीफाई किये है इस मैच में लॉस एंजेल्स के ख़िलाफ़ एमआई टीम के गेंदबाज़ो और बल्लेबाज़ों ने बहुत अच्छे अंदाज़ में बेहतरीन प्रदर्शन किया है जिसके चलते इस टीम की उम्मीद बाक़ी है अब आगे की रह केसी रहेगी ये उनके प्रतिभा पर निर्भर करता है हालांकि इस जीत के बाद टीम के खिलाडियों में जोश आया है और उन्हें उम्मीद है की वो आगे भी अच्छा प्रदर्शन करेंगे।

गेंदबाज़ी और बल्लेबाज़ी रही कमाल – Major League Cricket 2024 Hindi

एमआई ने टॉस जीतकर मैच जीत लिया और टूर्नामेंट में अच्छे अंदाज़ से वापसी की है जिसमें एमएलसी टीम के गेंदबाज़ रशीद खान ने अहम भूमिका निभाई है जिसमें उन्होंने अपने स्पेल में 30 देकर सामने वाली टीम के 3 अहम विकेट चटकाए है। जिसके लिए राशिद खान को प्लेयर ऑफ द मैच चुना गया है जिनकी बदौलत एमआई ने खेल में वापसी की है। वही ट्रेंट बोल्ट ने भी अच्छी गेंदबाज़ी की है जिसमें उन्होंने अपनी टीम के लिए 2 विकेट चटकाए हालांकि उन्होंने 38 रन ज़्यादा दिए।

एमआई के गेंदबाज़ नास्तुस ने भी अच्छी गेंदबाज़ी की है जहाँ उन्होंने 2 विकेट हासिल किये और 22 रन मात्र दिए है। रोमरिओ शेफर्ड ने 4 ओवर में 30 रन दिए और मात्र 1 विकेट हासिल किया। और कप्तान पोलार्ड ने एक गेंद फेंकी जिसमें उन्होंने 1 विकेट हासिल किया। इस तरह एमआई न्यूयोर्क के गेंदबाज़ो ने लॉस एंजेल्स नाईट राइडर को 130 रनो पर आल आउट कर दिया।

130 रनो के स्कोर को एमआई टीम ने बहुत आसानी से हासिल कर लिया जहाँ 17 ओवर में 6 विकेट खोकर एमआई ने मैच जीत लिया है जिसमें सर्वाधिक रन किकेट कीपर निकोलस पुरान ने बनाये है उन्होंने 28 गेंदों में 35 रन बनाये जिसमें 2 चौके और 2 छक्के भी शामिल थे उनके अलावा कप्तान किरेन पोलार्ड ने 12 गेंदों में 33 रनो की नावाद पारी खेली वही ब्रेविस ने 5 चोको की मदद से 27 रन बनाये वही आल रॉडार राशिद खान को मात्र 5 गेंदे खेलने का मौका मिला जिसमें उन्होंने 5 रन बनाये और अंत तक नावाद रहे।
summary:
**Match Result:** MI New York defeated Los Angeles Night Riders by 6 wickets in the 19th match of the MLC 2024 tournament.

**Key Performers:** Rashid Khan, the Afghan star player, was the hero for MI New York, taking 3 crucial wickets for 30 runs and earning the Player of the Match award. Trent Boult and Nastus also contributed to the team's bowling effort, taking 2 wickets each. Nicholas Pooran top-scored for MI New York with 35 runs, while captain Kieron Pollard and Bravo chipped in with 33 and 27 runs respectively.

**Tournament Standing:** Despite a disappointing start to the tournament, MI New York, the defending champions, have made a strong comeback and qualified for the Super 4 stage with a better run rate than Los Angeles Night Riders.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: With a berth in the final at stake, Washington Freedom meet San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier
body:
Washington Freedom will aim to be the first team to enter the final of the Major League Cricket 2024 season when we meet the San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday.

Our Qualifier match against SFU on July 25 is scheduled to start at 7:30 PM CT (July 26, 6:00 AM IST). The MLC 2024 game will be available to watch via live streaming and broadcast.

The top two teams in the MLC 2024 points table will meet in the Qualifier and the winning team will directly proceed to the final. The losing side will have one more shot at redemption when they meet the winners of the Eliminator contest, a match between the third and fourth-placed teams.

We lost to SFU by six wickets (DLS method) in our last league game in Dallas on Monday, the first defeat of our MLC campaign this year.

However, we finished on top of the MLC 2024 points table with 11 points from seven games, ahead of SFU on net run rate.

Travis Head and skipper Steve Smith shone at the top of the order with half-centuries while Andrew Tye picked up three wickets, albeit in a losing cause, in a rain-shortened encounter.

Saurabh Netravalkar is on top of the bowling charts in MLC 2024 with 12 wickets from just five matches at an average of 12.16 runs and an astonishing strike rate of 9.16.

Meanwhile, Head and Smith have moved to second and third in the overall batters’ list. Head has 250 runs from seven matches at an average of 41.66 and an excellent strike rate of 173.61 whereas Smith has accumulated 247 runs at an unbelievable average of 61.75 and a strike rate of 144.44.

WF vs SFU form in MLC

We have won four of our last five league games in the MLC 2024 season with the six-wicket loss to San Francisco Unicorns on Monday being the only defeat this year. We have met SFU twice in the history of MLC with both teams winning a match apiece.

Washington Freedom's last five matches

WF vs SFU, Qualifier MLC 2024: Players to watch out

Head, Smith and Tye were the positives that shone brightly in our loss to the San Francisco Unicorns in the last match. For a change, Smith outscored his left-handed opening partner during the powerplay.

Our skipper smashed three sixes and five fours as he raced to 44 off just 22 balls to power us to 70/0 after the first six overs. Meanwhile, Head shifted gears, once Smith departed, to complete his fourth straight fifty in MLC.

Both Smith and Head were involved in a record partnership adding 101 runs, our highest for any wicket in the MLC, for the opening wicket against SFU. The duo have scored a total of 497 runs out of our total 936 runs this season, a whopping 53%, at a fast clip as well. Another flying start on Thursday and we will have one leg in the final.

Tye, playing his first game of the season, picked up three wickets against SFU in our last match. Though Tye was a bit expensive, he dismissed big-hitters Jake Fraser-McGurk, Josh Inglis and Sherfane Rutherford, the last two in the same over, to keep us in the game right through the defense.

Meanwhile, Netravalkar will be our trump card once again with his best spell in the MLC coming against the same opponent last year. His astonishing figures of 6/9 against SFU in 2023 helped us win a low-scoring game by a comfortable 30-run margin.

Washington Freedom squad: Steven Smith (c), Akhilesh Reddy, Jack Edwards, Andries Gous, Travis Head, Lahiru Milantha, Mukhtar Ahmed, Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Rachin Ravindra, Amila Aponso, Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrew Tye, Yasir Mohammad

Where to watch WF vs SFU Qualifier MLC 2024 LIVE

LIVE telecast and streaming of the Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns match will be available on Monumental Sports Network and Willow by Cricbuzz in the USA. The match will start at 7:30 PM CT on July 25.

The WF vs SFU match will be streamed LIVE on the Jio Cinema App and website in India starting at 06:00 AM IST on July 26.
summary:
* The Washington Freedom team will face the San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier match at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 25, with the winner advancing directly to the final.
* The match will start at 7:30 PM CT (July 26, 6:00 AM IST) and will be available for live streaming and broadcast.
* The top two teams in the MLC 2024 points table, Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns, will compete in the Qualifier, with the losing team getting another chance to reach the final by playing the winner of the Eliminator match.
* Washington Freedom finished at the top of the points table with 11 points from seven games, ahead of San Francisco Unicorns on net run rate.
* Key players to watch out for in the Qualifier match are Travis Head, Steve Smith, and Andrew Tye, who performed well in the last league game against San Francisco Unicorns.
* Saurabh Netravalkar is currently leading the bowling charts in MLC 2024 with 12 wickets from five matches, while Head and Smith are second and third in the overall batters' list.

Overall, the Washington Freedom team is looking to become the first team to enter the final of the MLC 2024 season by winning the Qualifier match against San Francisco Unicorns.
