title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings Washed Out After Faf du Plessis Century
body:
oi-Aditya K Halder

The fifth match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Tuesday was unfortunately called off due to rain.

This much-anticipated game saw Washington Freedom chasing a challenging target of 204 runs, reaching 62 for 0 in just four overs before the downpour interrupted play.

Travis Head had a rapid start, scoring 32 runs off 12 balls, while Steve Smith followed closely with 26 runs off 12 balls. The duo looked poised for a strong partnership when the rain halted their progress.

Despite an hour-long wait for the weather to clear, match officials eventually decided to call off the game, resulting in both teams sharing a point each from the rain-affected match.

This encounter was significant as it marked the first instance of any team surpassing 200 runs this season and also the first occurrence of a 200-run total at Church Street Park.

Earlier in the match, Texas Super Kings, led by captain Faf du Plessis, set an impressive total of 203 for 5 in their 20 overs. Du Plessis delivered a stellar performance, scoring a brilliant century off 58 balls.

His innings were marked by aggressive and calculated shots, consistently punishing any loose deliveries from the Washington bowlers. Devon Conway provided crucial support, scoring 39 runs off 26 balls. Together, du Plessis and Conway built a solid 109-run partnership for the opening wicket.

Despite dealing with an injured right hand, Marcus Stoinis contributed a vital 29 runs off 18 balls, further boosting the Texas Super Kings' total. However, Washington Freedom's bowling and fielding were below par, with several dropped catches and missed opportunities that allowed the Texas Super Kings to amass their substantial total.

While the rain ultimately denied what could have been an exciting finish, both teams displayed promising performances. The Washington Freedom's explosive start in their chase and the Texas Super Kings' formidable batting display, particularly from Faf du Plessis, set a high standard for the rest of the season.

Both teams will look to build on these performances as the Major League Cricket season progresses, aiming to secure their positions in the tournament standings.
summary:
* The 5th match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season between Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings was abandoned due to rain.
* The match was played at Church Street Park in Morrisville, where Texas Super Kings set a target of 204 runs, with Faf du Plessis scoring a century off 58 balls.
* Washington Freedom was 62 for 0 in 4 overs, with Travis Head scoring 32 runs off 12 balls and Steve Smith scoring 26 runs off 12 balls, when the rain stopped play.
* The match was significant as it marked the first 200-run total of the season and the first at Church Street Park.
* Both teams shared a point each from the rain-affected match.
* The match showcased promising performances from both teams, with Washington Freedom's explosive start in their chase and Texas Super Kings' formidable batting display, particularly from Faf du Plessis.

title: Andre Russell Smashes Massive 107M Six off Haris Rauf’s Bowling During San Francisco Unicorns vs LA Knight Riders MLC 2024 Match (Watch Video)
body:
Andre Russell's big-hitting skills are almost second to none in T20s, and the West Indies once again gave an example of that as he smashed a massive 107m six off Haris Rauf's bowling during the San Francisco Unicorns vs LA Knight Riders match in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 on Monday, July 8. The right-hander came up a mighty swing on the leg side and connected with the shot, sending the ball flying out of the stadium. Russell finished a 40-run blitz off just 25 balls, a knock which included two fours and three sixes, but it was not enough for LA Knight Riders to beat San Francisco Unicorns. title: major league cricket 2024 Cricket News
body:
The San Francisco Unicorns completed a comprehensive victory with six wickets and 28 balls to spare, against the LA Knight Riders in the fourth match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket. Electing to bowl first at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas the San Francisco Unicorns limited the LA Knight Riders to 165/6, with debutant Broady Couch (2/24) and Harris Rauf (2/38) bagging two wickets each, before blistering half-centuries from Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) orchestrated a swift run chase for the Unicorns.

Andre Russel’s (40*) late innings surge proved too little for the LA Knight Riders, whose star batsmen such as David Miller (24), Shakib Al Hassan (35) and Jason Roy (26) failed to capitalize on their starts.

title: [Watch] Steve Smith Unleashes Beast Mode With Colossal Sixes Vs Super Kings In MLC 2024
body:
Steve Smith has been in stunning form in MLC 2024 (x.com)

In a striking reproach to the selectors who overlooked him for the T20 World Cup 2024, Australian cricket veteran Steve Smith has unleashed a storm of runs in his debut at the Major League Cricket in the United States.

Smith, playing for Washington Freedom, has quickly turned heads with his explosive batting displays that left spectators and critics alike in awe.

In his inaugural match for Washington Freedom against MI New York, Steve Smith blasted a rapid 46 off 28 balls, propelling his team to a narrow four-run victory by the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method. His innings was a critical factor in Washington’s win, setting the tone for what was to come.

Steve Smith unleashes six-hitting storm in MLC 2024

The fireworks continued in Washington's second outing against the Texas Super Kings. After the Super Kings, led by captain Faf du Plessis—who scored a brilliant century (100 off 58)—posted a colossal total of 203/5, Smith and opener Travis Head responded with ferocity. The duo put on a blistering 62-run stand in just four overs.

Steve Smith's aggressive approach was highlighted in the third over when he hammered Zia-ul-Haq for two massive sixes.

The first, a magnificent hook off a slower short ball, soared over fine leg. He followed up with a hefty blow over deep square leg from a full-length delivery, showcasing his brilliance and intent.

Watch: Steve Smith sixes in MLC 2024

Before the rain gods intervened with Washington Freedom at 62/0, Smith had notched up an unbeaten 26 from 13 deliveries, studded with three sixes, though the match ultimately concluded with no result due to the weather.

Despite the anticlimactic end to his second game, Smith’s performances have sent a clear message: he is here to dominate.
summary:
* Steve Smith, playing for Washington Freedom, has been in exceptional form in the MLC 2024 tournament.
* In his debut match against MI New York, Smith scored a rapid 46 off 28 balls, leading his team to a narrow four-run victory by the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method.
* In the second match against the Texas Super Kings, Smith and opener Travis Head put on a blistering 62-run stand in just four overs, with Smith scoring 26 off 13 deliveries with three sixes before the match was called off due to rain.
* Smith's aggressive batting displays have sent a strong message that he is here to dominate the tournament.
* The teams mentioned in the article are Washington Freedom, MI New York, and Texas Super Kings, with Faf du Plessis as the captain of the Texas Super Kings.

title: [Watch] 6, 6, 6 - Rashid Khan Lights Up MLC 2024; Bludgeons Marco Jansen With Hat-Trick Of Sixes
body:
Rashid Khan takes the attack to Marco Jansen (X.com)

Rashid Khan made headlines yet again on Sunday while representing MI New York during their Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 fixture against Washington Freedom at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

However, the Afghanistan sensation, this time around, hogged the limelight due to his batting heroics, and it was Marco Jansen who was at the receiving end.

Rashid Khan Thrashes Marco Jansen In MLC 2024

In his entertaining 15-ball 31 run knock, Rashid smashed three sixes on the bounce during the 18th over of Mumbai's innings. Two of his sixes were over deep mid-wicket, while one was over long-on for a half-of-dozen.

To make matters worse for Jansen, Rashid smashed a four off the last ball, making it a 23-run over.

However, Rashid's brisk knock went in vain for MI New York, as Washington Freedom defeated them by four runs via DLS method. In reply of MI New York's 154/9, Washington reached 55/1 in 7.4 overs before heavy lightning did not allow any further play.

Despite the defeat, MI New York remained at the top of the points table, as they cruised past Seattle Orcas in the tournament opener.
summary:
* The article reports on a match between MI New York and Washington Freedom at Church Street Park, Morrisville, in the MLC 2024 tournament.
* Rashid Khan, playing for MI New York, scored 31 runs off 15 balls, including three consecutive sixes and a four, in the 18th over against Marco Jansen.
* Despite Rashid's impressive batting, MI New York lost the match to Washington Freedom by four runs via the DLS method.
* MI New York scored 154/9, while Washington Freedom reached 55/1 in 7.4 overs before the match was halted due to bad weather.
* Despite the loss, MI New York remains at the top of the points table after winning their tournament opener against Seattle Orcas.

title: Bangladeshi players' performance in foreign cricket leagues: Updates from LPL and MLC
body:
While the Bangladesh national team has no ongoing assignments, some key players are participating in foreign leagues, including the Lanka Premier League (LPL) and Major League Cricket (MLC).

Batter Towhid Hridoy and pace bowlers Taskin Ahmed and Mustafizur Rahman are competing in the LPL in Sri Lanka, while Shakib Al Hasan is playing in the MLC in the USA.

Towhid, representing the Dambulla Sixers, played two matches before losing his spot in the playing XI. He scored only one run in his first match and did not get a chance to bat in the second.

Taskin, playing for the Colombo Strikers, bagged three wickets in his first two matches but proved expensive. Mustafizur, also representing the Dambulla Sixers, has taken five wickets in four matches but has also been expensive, conceding 53 runs in his last match on July 7th.

Shakib is playing for the Los Angeles Knight Riders in the MLC. In two matches, he scored 53 runs and took one wicket. He is the only Bangladeshi player participating in the MLC.

After the MLC, Shakib will join all-rounder Mohammad Saifuddin in the Global T20 in Canada.

title: WATCH | Shakib Al Hasan goes speechless as Russell smashes 107-meter six off Haris Rauf
body:
By SportsCafe Desk , SportsCafe Editor

4935

In an era where rockets and satellites regularly soar into space, few batters possess the power to metaphorically send a cricket ball there. But such was the spectacle in Major League Cricket when Andre Russell launched a colossal 107-meter six off Haris Rauf, leaving his teammates in awe.

‌The San Francisco Unicorns clashed with the Los Angeles Knight Riders in their opening game in Dallas. Unicorns skipper Corey Anderson won the toss and chose to bowl first, a decision that initially proved effective as IPL MVP Sunil Narine was scalped by Haris Rauf in the second over. With Jason Roy and Unmukt Chand’s dismissal, the Knight Riders struggled at 46/3 after seven overs. However, a vital 45-run partnership between Shakib Al Hasan and Nitish Kumar took them to 88/3 by the 11th over. It was Andre Russell's explosive innings, featuring a colossal 107-meter six, that then further propelled the purple brigade to a solid 165/6 in 20 overs.

The West Indian powerhouse walked in to bat in the 13th over following Kumar's dismissal. Russell took some time to find his rhythm but began his onslaught from the 16th over onwards, saving the most spectacular moment for the 20th over. On the third ball of the final over, Rauf delivered a short-length ball angled into the stumps. Russell used his flawless judgment as he stood tall and unleashed a mighty pull shot. The timing was impeccable, and the sweet sound of the bat carried the ball out of the ground for a maximum. The shot travelled an astounding 351 feet, marking the longest six of the season. The Knight Riders' dugout, especially Shakib, was momentarily in disbelief at the incredible display.

Russell-Mania at Dallas

1

0

1

0

1

0
summary:
* The article reports on a match between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket tournament.
* The Knight Riders batted first and struggled early on, losing three wickets for 46 runs in seven overs.
* A partnership between Shakib Al Hasan and Nitish Kumar helped the Knight Riders recover, and they eventually scored 165/6 in 20 overs.
* The highlight of the match was an explosive innings by Andre Russell, who hit a 107-meter six off Haris Rauf in the 20th over, which was the longest six of the season.
* Russell's shot was described as a "colossal" and "mightily pulled" shot, and his teammates, including Shakib Al Hasan, were left in awe.

title: [Watch] 6,6,6: Finn Allen Goes Berserk Against Shakib Al Hasan In MLC 2024
body:
Finn Allen takes down Shakib Al Hasan [X]

New Zealand explosive opener Finn Allen went ballistic against Shakib Al Hasan during an MLC game between San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders when he rammed him for 3 sixes on the trot in the powerplay of the 166-run chase.

Major League Cricket has picked up pace with an enthralling encounter between San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders taking place on July 7 at Dallas.

Knight Riders batted first, and courtesy of Andre Russell’s 40 (25) finish, LAKR posted a target of 166 runs on board for the Unicorns.

Finn Allen goes berserk Vs Shakib Al Hasan

While the game looked evenly poised, Finn Allen turned it into a one-sided contest with a sheer display of formidable power hitting in the powerplay.

Despite losing partner Fraser McGurk early, Allen didn’t change his approach. A 12-run-over from Spencer Jones set the tone right for the Kiwi, and he continued the momentum against Andre Russell to fetch 17 runs off the 5th over.

With 48 runs already on the board, Finn Allen went for the final punch against Shakib Al Hasan in the final over. He slammed an overpitched slot ball over wide long-on to record the first six of the over.

With Shakib under the pump, Allen went on the back foot to loft another maximum over the long-on boundary rope.

Before the spinner could catch a break, the Kiwi once again used the depth of his crease to hammer another six, this time the ball travelled out of the ground.

With a 19-run over, San Francisco Unicorns were 67/1 inside the first six overs and went on to wrap up the chase with four overs to spare.

The Unicorns secured their maiden win of the tournament and climbed to the top of the table with a healthy net run rate.
summary:
* The match was played between San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders on July 7 at Dallas.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders batted first and scored 166 runs, thanks to Andre Russell's 40 off 25 balls.
* Finn Allen, the New Zealand opener, led the chase for San Francisco Unicorns, scoring heavily in the powerplay.
* Allen hit 3 sixes in a row off Shakib Al Hasan's over, contributing to a 19-run over, and helping his team reach 67/1 in the first 6 overs.
* San Francisco Unicorns eventually won the match with 4 overs to spare, earning their maiden win of the tournament and moving to the top of the table with a healthy net run rate.

title: Prime Video secure exclusive broadcast rights for the 2024 MLC season
body:
Share

Tweet

Share

Email

Prime Video and Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) have unveiled a partnership to grant Prime Video exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season.

All 25 matches will be available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand from 6 July – 29 July local time (5 July – 28 July in the USA) at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

The announcement comes after the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, which Prime Video also had the exclusive broadcast rights to. Co-host of the tournament the USA progressed to the Super Eight stage in their tournament debut.

The second season of MLC will provide a stage for international T20 superstars to compete alongside the USA’s top domestic players from six major cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.

Across the six teams, eight Australian players and five New Zealander players have been confirmed to participate in the tournament.

• Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins joins the San Francisco Unicorns alongside bowler Josh Inglis, batter Jake Fraser-McGurk, and New Zealand all-rounder Matt Henry.

• Seattle Orcas have nabbed Kiwi batsman Michael Bracewell and bowler Lance Morris.

• Washington Freedom have secured Ricky Ponting as coach, as well as Australian batters Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell. New Zealand’s bowlers Rachin Ravindra and Lockie Ferguson are also named in the squad.

• MI New York will see batter Tim David and bowler Trent Boult return for a second season.

• Australian bowler Adam Zampa will join the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

“At Prime Video, we are always looking for ways to deliver more value to our customers across our movies, TV series and live sports offerings,” said Hushidar Kharas, Head of Prime Video Australia and New Zealand.

“The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket. We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

“We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia,” said MLC’s CEO, Vijay Srinivasan.

“This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in it’s second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe. Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test.

“MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

The MLC and Prime Video partnership comes as the Prominence and Anti-Siphoning Bill was passed without amendment by the Senate last week.

This means subscription streamers, such as Prime Video, Netflix and Foxtel’s Kayo could now outbid free-to-air networks for digital streaming rights for Australian sporting events.

While streaming services, as well as subscription TV, cannot buy the free broadcast (aerial delivered) rights until a free-to-air broadcaster, such as Nine, Seven, or 10, has acquired them, they are not stopped from bidding on the streaming rights that free-to-air broadcasters currently have on their respective BVOD services (9Now, 7Plus, 10 Play or SBS On Demand).
summary:
The MLC has announced a partnership with Prime Video to grant exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season. The tournament will feature 25 matches from July 6-29, which will be available on Prime Video at no extra cost to Prime or Prime Video members.

The second season of MLC will see international T20 superstars compete alongside top domestic players from six major cities in the USA, including Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. The tournament will feature eight Australian players and five New Zealand players, including notable names such as Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell.

The six teams participating in the tournament are the San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Washington Freedom, MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and Dallas. Each team has a mix of international and domestic players, with coaches including Ricky Ponting.

The season is also short. It’s just a few weeks from now until the MLC 2024 final on Sunday, July 28.

If you’re looking for last-minute tickets, there are tickets available to buy on third-party sites such as Vivid Seats and StubHub. Plus, you can use Variety’s exclusive promo code VAR2024 to get $20 off Vivid Seats.

Want to watch Major League Cricket online? Here’s everything you need to know about live streaming options.

How to watch Major League Cricket 2024

There are multiple ways to watch, as the MLC will be broadcast on regional sports networks across the US, both on TV and online. However, cricket fans can live stream all MLC matches on Willow HD, available on Sling TV or Fubo.

On Sling, Willow HD is part of the service’s Dakshin Flex package, which starts at $10 per month. It includes live and on-demand cricket matches, as well as movies and TV shows from channels such as Star India, Hotstar Specials, and Vijay TV. These channels and services are available in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, and other languages.

You can also purchase an annual subscription for $99 per year, which is about 45% off the monthly rate.

As for Fubo, Willow HD is part of all streaming service plans starting at $79.99 per month. The plan includes 145+ channels including CBS, ABC, FX, NBC, HGTV, CNN, ESPN, Fox Sports, NFL Network, and more, unlimited cloud DVR, and up to 10 streams simultaneously across multiple devices. Plus, Fubo offers a 7-day free trial so you can try it out for a week before committing.

If you’re outside the US but still want to watch the MLC games, you can use a virtual private network like ExpressVPN or NordVPN. These are online subscriptions that allow you to access live feeds of cricket matches using any of the streaming services listed above, even if you’re not in the US. ExpressVPN (starting at $6.67 per month) and NordVPN (starting at $3.39 per month) can be accessed on your laptop, streaming device, tablet, or smartphone.

Major League Cricket 2024 is available to stream on Willow HD via Sling or Fubo from now until Sunday, July 28. The MLC final will be held at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

title: San Francisco Unicorns Dominate LA Knight Riders in MLC Showdown
body:
The San Francisco Unicorns executed a commanding six-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders with 28 balls to spare in the fourth match of the 2024 Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. Electing to bowl first, the Unicorns restricted the Knight Riders to 165/6, with debutant Broady Couch (2/24) and Harris Rauf (2/38) taking two wickets each.

Blistering half-centuries from Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) guided the Unicorns' swift chase. Despite a late effort from Andre Russell (40*), the Knight Riders fell short as their key batsmen, including David Miller (24), Shakib Al Hassan (35), and Jason Roy (26), failed to capitalize on good starts.

The Unicorns' response saw opener Jake Fraser Mcgurk dismissed early, but Allen's aggressive knock, including five sixes in consecutive deliveries, set the tone. By the end of the powerplay, the Unicorns were 67/1. Short then took charge, bringing up his half-century alongside Allen. Their 116-run partnership set up an easy chase, completed with 15.2 overs, despite Allen's dismissal. Josh Inglis (15), Corey Anderson (11), and Hassan Khan (2) provided the finishing touches. Johnson led the Knight Riders' bowling with 3/36.

(Disclaimer: With inputs from agencies.)
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns defeat LA Knight Riders by 6 wickets in the 4th match of the 2024 Major League Cricket tournament at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

* Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) scored blistering half-centuries to guide the Unicorns' chase.
* Andre Russell (40*) made a late effort for the Knight Riders, but it was not enough.

**Other Notable Mentions:**

* The Unicorns completed their chase with 15.2 overs to spare, thanks to a 116-run partnership between Allen and Short.
* Johnson led the Knight Riders' bowling with 3/36.

title: Andre Russell’s Massive Six Against San Francisco Unicorns Lights Up the MLC Stage
body:
The T20 season from the cricket world never goes off. Just a few days ago another edition of the T20 World Cup ended. But the thrilling Major League Cricket is back with another thrilling edition. In the last match, LA Knight Riders and San Fransisco Unicorns locked horns. But in that match, Andre Russell’s monstrous 351 feet six caught all the limelight,

Monstrous Six by Russell:

In the T20 cricket, every ball is exciting. After an exciting edition of the T20 World Cup, cricket enthusiasts are witnessing another thrilling edition of the Major League Cricket.

In the fourth match of the league, LA Knight Riders and San Francisco Unicorns locked horns and the fans watched another thrilling match.

As the match was exciting, Knight Riders player Andre Russell’s monstrous sox of 351 feet grabbed the limelight. The exciting moment took place in the first innings. In the last over, Haris Rauf came to bowl and Andre Russell was on strike. Rauf delivered a short ball angling in, prompting Russell to line it up perfectly and send it soaring over wide long-on for a massive six, measuring 351 feet. That was a thunderous shot by the power-hitter.

Unicorn’s Exciting Win Over Knights:

The USA cricket fans are enjoying another thrilling edition of the Major League Cricket. In the fourth match of the league, LA Knight Riders faced San Francisco Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium. After winning the toss, the Unicorns opted to field first. While bowling in the first innings, the bowlers dominated the opponent.

Haris Rauf got the first breakthrough for the team while dismissing Sunil Narine. Brody Couch secured 2 crucial wickets just by conceding 24 runs. Rauf ended up taking 2 wickets. Abrar Ahmed and Liam Plunket secured 1 wicket each and restricted the opponent in 165 runs.

While batting in the second innings, the Unicorn Batters lost an early wicket as Jake Fraser McGurk was dismissed in 9 runs. But Finn Allen and Matthew Short played responsible innings. Aleen played a knock of 63 runs in 37 balls. Short completed his half-century and played a knock of 58 runs in 26 balls. With their dazzling displays, they secured win in the 16th over and won the match by 6 wickets.

title: WATCH: Faf du Plessis roars back into form with a stunning century in MLC 2024 | TSK vs WF
body:
Global star Faf du Plessis lit up the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas with his magnificent century in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. Leading the Texas Super Kings (TSK) against the Washington Freedom (WF), Du Plessis dazzled with the bat, smashing a tremendous ton to announce his grand arrival in the US T20 tournament.

Struggles in previous MLC season

Notably, Du Plessis didn’t have a good time with the bat in MLC. He scored only 47 runs in the previous season of the exciting tournament and his start in the ongoing edition wasn’t promising either.. The right-handed batter managed just 14 runs in TSK’s opening game against the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LKR). Under significant pressure, Du Plessis needed to find his form, and he did so emphatically with a spectacular three-figure score.

A tremendous century to mark his return

During his stay in the middle, Du Plessis smashed 12 fours and five sixes to exhibit a batting brilliance. He was dismissed for exact 100 runs from 58 deliveries by Saurabh Netravalkar. Notably, on the last ball of the 18th over, Du Plessis reached the milestone by driving the slower leg-cutter pitched full outside off Lockie Ferguson for a boundary. Overall, it was his 6th hundred in the shortest format and the entire TSK dugout was up to applaud their captain’s knock.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Finn Allen slams Shakib Al Hasan for a hat-trick of sixes as SFU defeat LAKR in MLC 2024

Rain spoils the exciting match

Driving on Du Plessis brilliant century, the Super Kings posted a massive total of 203/5 in 20 overs. However, his magical ton went in vain as the match ended without a result due to rain. Washington started their chase strongly, scoring 62 runs in just four overs with Travis Head (32 runs off 12 balls) and Steve Smith (26 runs off 13 balls) looking well set. Unfortunately, rain intervened after four overs, preventing the match from restarting. As a result, the game was cancelled, and both sides shared a point each.
summary:
**Match Summary:** The Texas Super Kings (TSK) led by Faf du Plessis played against the Washington Freedom (WF) in the MLC 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Faf du Plessis' Century:** Du Plessis scored a magnificent century (100 runs from 58 deliveries) with 12 fours and 5 sixes, his 6th hundred in the T20 format, to lead TSK to a massive total of 203/5 in 20 overs.

**Background:** Du Plessis had a poor previous MLC season, scoring only 47 runs, and struggled in the opening game of the ongoing season with just 14 runs.

**Match Outcome:** Unfortunately, the match was cancelled due to rain after four overs of WF's chase, with Travis Head and Steve Smith looking strong. Both teams shared a point each.

No other relevant information about the MLC tournament is present in the article.

title: WATCH: Finn Allen slams Shakib Al Hasan for a hat-trick of sixes as SFU defeat LAKR in MLC 2024
body:
In a thrilling match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, the San Francisco Unicorns defeated the Los Angeles Knight Riders by six wickets at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday, July 8. The star of the show was New Zealand opener Finn Allen, who put on a spectacular display of power-hitting against the Knight Riders’ bowling attack.

Finn Allen’s carnage against LAKR

Allen smashed Shakib Al Hasan for three consecutive sixes in the fifth over, sending the ball deep into the stands. He continued his onslaught in the seventh over, hitting Andre Russell for two more maximums, taking his tally to five sixes across the two overs.

Here’s the video

Allen’s blistering knock of 63 off just 37 balls, at a strike rate of 170.27, laid the foundation for the Unicorns’ successful chase. He was ably supported by Matthew Short, who scored a quickfire 58 off 26 deliveries, as the pair added 116 runs for the second wicket.

Match summary

The Knight Riders, after being put in to bat first, posted a competitive total of 165/6 in their allotted 20 overs. Shakib (35) and Russell (40 off 25 balls) were the main contributors with the bat for the Knight Riders. For the Unicorns, Brody Couch and Haris Rauf picked up two wickets each, while Abrar Ahmad and Liam Plunkett chipped in with one apiece.

In response, the Unicorns got off to a flying start, thanks to the explosive batting of Allen and Short. Allen, in particular, was in a belligerent mood as he took on the Knight Riders’ bowlers, especially Shakib and Russell.

The Unicorns eventually reached their target in 15.2 overs, winning the match by six wickets. Spencer Johnson was the pick of the bowlers for the Knight Riders, finishing with figures of 3/30.

Also READ: Andre Russell smokes gigantic 107m six off Haris Rauf in SFU vs LAKR game

Words from the match-winning duo

Speaking at the post-match presentation, a delighted Allen said, “It was a great team effort. The bowlers set it up nicely for us, and we just had to go out there and express ourselves. I’m glad I could contribute with the bat and help the team get over the line.”

Short, who was named the Player of the Match, echoed Allen’s sentiments of the dressing room, saying, “We are joking in the change room as to who can hit the biggest sixes. I think the pitch got better to bat on under lights, probably dew played a part as well. This tournament has a lot of good players.”

The win puts the Unicorns in a strong position in the MLC 2024 standings, while the Knight Riders will look to bounce back in their next match. With players like Allen and Short in their ranks, the Unicorns will be a force to be reckoned with in the tournament.
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders by six wickets at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday, July 8.

**Star Performers:**

* Finn Allen (San Francisco Unicorns): Scored 63 off 37 balls at a strike rate of 170.27, with five sixes.
* Matthew Short (San Francisco Unicorns): Scored 58 off 26 deliveries, adding 116 runs for the second wicket with Finn Allen.

**Match Summary:**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders posted 165/6 in 20 overs, with Shakib Al Hasan (35) and Andre Russell (40 off 25 balls) being the top scorers.
* San Francisco Unicorns bowlers Brody Couch and Haris Rauf picked up two wickets each, while Abrar Ahmad and Liam Plunkett took one wicket each.
* In response, the Unicorns chased down the target in 15.2 overs, thanks to Allen and Short's explosive batting.
* Spencer Johnson was the best bowler for the Knight Riders, finishing with figures of 3/30.

**Tournament Implications:**

* The win puts the San Francisco Unicorns in a strong position in the MLC 2024 standings.
* The Unicorns, with players like Finn Allen and Matthew Short, are expected to be a force to be reckoned with in the tournament.

title: Watch: Andre Russell's humongous 107-meter six in MLC leaves Haris Rauf shell-shocked
body:
West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell looked in a mood with the bat during the game between the San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket (MLC). The match between the two teams took place at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday (8th July).

Playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders, Andre Russell played a sensational innings for his team and made sure that he helped them post a decent total on the board. The all-rounder oozed his class with the bat and exhibited great power-hitting skills during the fag end of the innings.

With the Los Angeles Knight Riders struggling at 96/5, Andre Russell stepped up for his team and made sure that he bailed the team out of trouble. He counter-attacked the bowlers and brought his team back into the game with his powerful knock while batting against San Francisco Unicorns.

One of the highlights of Andre Russell's innings was the massive 107-meter that he hit against Haris Rauf. During the last over, the pacer bowled a short ball angling in, to which the batter lined it up and smashed it over wide long-on for a massive six.

The massive six by Andre Russell left the pacer Haris Rauf in shock as he didn't expect the batter to hit the six this far. Apart from the pacer, Los Angeles Knight Riders players in the dugout looked extremely jubilant as the ball went out of the ground for a massive six and the crowd at the stadium went berserk.

Here's video of Andre Russel's massive six against Haris Rauf:

Andre Russell ended with the innings of unbeaten 40 runs off 25 balls. He batted with a strike rate of 160 and also hit 2 fours and 3 sixes in his innings. His brutal innings in the end powered Los Angeles Knight Riders to a total of 165 runs, which at one moment seemed impossible.

However, his effort went in vain as San Francisco Unicorns went on to win the game pretty easily. Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) played magnificently well and helped their team win the game by 6 wickets and inside the 16 overs.

We were 15-20 runs short - Los Angels Knight Riders skipper Sunil Narine

Los Angeles Knight Riders skipper Sunil Narine talked about the loss that his side faced against San Francisco Unicorns. He admitted that they were 15-20 runs short and also failed to take early wickets. He was confident of doing well in the next game. Speaking after the match, he stated:

"We had to take early wickets, 15-20 runs short. We could have taken early wickets but didn't bowl well. We got 160 in two games so we aren't too far from getting a big score. Just about batters digging deep. I back myself with my decisions. I didn't work today, hopefully, they work in the next game," he concluded.
summary:
**Match Summary:**
In a Major League Cricket (MLC) match between the San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders, the Unicorns won by 6 wickets with 4 overs to spare at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday.

**Andre Russell's Innings:**
Andre Russell, playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders, played a sensational innings, scoring an unbeaten 40 off 25 balls at a strike rate of 160, with 2 fours and 3 sixes, including a massive 107-meter six against Haris Rauf. His knock helped the Knight Riders post a total of 165 runs.

**Post-Match Reaction:**
Los Angeles Knight Riders skipper Sunil Narine acknowledged that they were 15-20 runs short and failed to take early wickets, but expressed confidence in their ability to bounce back in the next game.

**Other Match Details:**
Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) played crucial roles in guiding San Francisco Unicorns to victory, achieving the target in just 15.4 overs.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom beat MI New York by four runs in a rain
body:
Saurabh Netravalkar and skipper Steve Smith guided Washington Freedom to a four-run win over MI New York in their rain-shortened opening match of Major League Cricket 2024 at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina on Saturday.

Netravalkar registered impressive figures of 3/24 as MI NY ended at 154/9 in their 20 overs. Medium-pacer Justin Dill picked up 3/33 while Nicholas Pooran scored 44 from 30 balls for MI NY.

In response, Smith hit three sixes and four boundaries to top-score in the contest with an unbeaten 46 off just 28 balls. We moved to 55/1 in 7.4 overs before rain intervened with us being ahead of the par score of 51 as per the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern system, a method for calculating par scores and targets in rain-affected matches.

Bowling first, Marco Jansen struck for us as early as the third over with Dill also picking up a wicket in the powerplay. We managed to keep MI NY to 39/2 after the first six overs.

Glenn Maxwell started his journey with us in the MLC with a wicket in his first over and Netravalkar provided a crucial breakthrough dismissing MI NY skipper Kieron Pollard with half the side back as the score read 91.

Though Lockie Ferguson dismissed dangerman Pooran, MI NY bounced back with a quickfire 33-run partnership for the eighth wicket. Netravalkar picked up two wickets in the final over, including Rashid Khan who scored 31, to bring us back in the game. The left-arm seamer, along with Dill, finished with three wickets.

Chasing 155, Smith got things rolling scoring 13 runs in the fourth over. He smashed two sixes and two fours off Anrich Nortje as we ended the powerplay at 43/1.

In the end that big over proved the turning point for us as rain interrupted play in the eighth over with the score at 55/1.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom won by 4 runs against MI New York in a rain-shortened match of Major League Cricket 2024.

**Scorecard:** MI New York: 154/9 in 20 overs, Washington Freedom: 55/1 in 7.4 overs (rain-interrupted)

**Key Performers:** Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom) - 3/24, Steve Smith (Washington Freedom) - 46* off 28 balls, Nicholas Pooran (MI New York) - 44 off 30 balls, Justin Dill (Washington Freedom) - 3/33.

**Key Moments:** Washington Freedom restricted MI New York to 154/9, thanks to Netravalkar's impressive bowling. Steve Smith's unbeaten 46 guided Washington Freedom to a win, with the team ahead of the par score when rain intervened.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Steve Smith to lead Washington Freedom
body:
Steve Smith will lead Washington Freedom’s charge in Major League Cricket 2024.

Smith will join our leadership group alongside former Australian skipper and legend Ricky Ponting, who has been appointed as our coach this season.

“Good to be here. Looking forward to taking part in this year’s tournament (MLC). We have a really exciting squad,” Smith said ahead of our first practice session.

“We will try and bring everyone together as quickly as possible and hopefully play some good cricket. We are going to go out there, doing our best to win games for the Freedom”

Smith takes the baton from fellow Australian Moises Henriques, who led us to a third-place finish in the inaugural edition of the MLC last year.

Smith led Australia in 38 Test matches from 2014 to 2023, winning 21 of those and losing just 10. He was also in charge of 58 One-Day Internationals for Australia, with the team winning 30 of those matches.

Under Smith’s astute leadership, Australia continued its prior dominance in international cricket across all formats.

Apart from captaincy, Smith is also one of the best batters in modern-day international cricket with loads of runs across formats. In 109 Tests for the Aussies, Smith has amassed 9685 at an average of just under 57. He has also accumulated 5446 runs in ODIs averaging close to 44.

Smith is also an experienced customer in T20 cricket having played a total of 246 T20s across the globe including 67 T20Is for Australia. He has more than 5000 runs, including three centuries, with a healthy average of 30.79 in the shortest format.

Smith became the first player from Sydney Sixers to score a century in the Big Bash League T20 tournament in 2023 and followed it up with another hundred in the space of just four days.

Smith is also the proud owner of several records and achievements throughout his playing career. He was the youngest player to be awarded the ICC Cricketer of the Year at the age of just 26. He also won the ICC Men’s Test Player of the Decade award from 2011-2020.

Smith is the fastest Australian and sixth-fastest ever to reach 10000 runs in international cricket. He is also the only player to win the ICC Test Player of the Year more than once.

Smith’s experience as a captain and player will help us in our journey forward in the MLC. Here’s wishing Steve Smith a great season ahead with us in the MLC.
summary:
**Tournament Update**: The article announces that Steve Smith will lead the Washington Freedom team in the 2024 edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament.

**Team News**: Smith will join the leadership group alongside coach Ricky Ponting, a former Australian skipper and legend. Smith takes over as captain from Moises Henriques, who led the team to a third-place finish in the inaugural MLC season.

**Player Profile**: The article highlights Smith's impressive cricketing credentials, including his experience as a captain and player. He has led Australia in 38 Test matches and 58 One-Day Internationals, with a strong winning record. Smith is also an accomplished batsman with over 10,000 runs in international cricket, including centuries in all formats.

**Expertise**: The article suggests that Smith's experience and leadership skills will be valuable assets for the Washington Freedom team in the MLC tournament.

title: LA Knight Riders Defeat Texas Super Kings by 12 Runs
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders Triumph Over Texas Super Kings by 12 Runs in MLC 2024 Opener

The Los Angeles Knight Riders showcased a stellar performance to defeat the Texas Super Kings by 12 runs in the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

Unmukt Chand’s impressive 68 off 45 balls powered the LA Knight Riders to a total of 162/7 in their 20 overs. Ali Khan then delivered a match-winning spell, taking four wickets for 33 runs, restricting the Texas Super Kings to 150/8 and sealing the victory.

Chasing 163, the Texas Super Kings started cautiously on a challenging batting wicket. Skipper Faf du Plessis (14 off 14) tried to accelerate but was dismissed by Spencer Johnson in the fifth over, caught by Derone Davis at mid-wicket. Aaron Hardie (11 off 14) fell to Shakib Al Hasan in the ninth over.

Opener Devon Conway kept the Super Kings in the hunt with timely boundaries. However, Ali Khan turned the game around for the Knight Riders by taking three wickets in the 14th over. He bowled Conway, dismissed Joshua Tromp (18 off 14) with a catch by Derone Davis, and had Milind Kumar (0 off 1) caught at slip by Andre Russell. Marcus Stoinis (2 off 6) fell in the following over, leaving the Super Kings reeling from 100/2 to 107/6 after 15 overs.

Calvin Savage then kept the Super Kings’ hopes alive with a flurry of boundaries and sixes. Along with Naveen-ul-Haq, he smashed 17 runs off Ali Khan in the 18th over, bringing the equation down to 27 runs from 12 balls. However, Russell and Khan bowled exceptional final overs to close out the game for the Knight Riders.

Earlier, Texas Super Kings won the toss and opted to bowl first. Zia-ul-Haq shook the LA Knight Riders’ lineup, dismissing openers Jason Roy (2 off 11) and Sunil Narine (2 off 3) in the third over, leaving them at 10/2.

Unmukt Chand and Shakib Al Hasan attempted to steady the innings, but Shakib fell to Aaron Hardie in the seventh over after scoring 18 off 13 balls. Nitish Kumar added 26 runs off 17 deliveries before being dismissed in the 11th over, with the score at 78/4.

Despite losing key players like David Miller (4 off 9) and Andre Russell (10 off 5), Chand held one end, scoring a magnificent 68 off 45 balls, with six boundaries and three sixes, anchoring the Knight Riders’ innings. He was dismissed in the last over, but Corne Dry’s three fours off Marcus Stoinis powered the Knight Riders to a respectable total of 162/7.
summary:
**Match Result:** Los Angeles Knight Riders defeated Texas Super Kings by 12 runs in the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**LA Knight Riders:** Unmukt Chand top-scored with 68 off 45 balls, helping the team reach a total of 162/7 in 20 overs. Ali Khan was the star of the show with a match-winning spell of 4/33, restricting the Texas Super Kings to 150/8.

**Texas Super Kings:** Devon Conway kept the Super Kings in the hunt with timely boundaries, but Ali Khan's three wickets in the 14th over turned the game around for the Knight Riders. Calvin Savage's late flurry of boundaries and sixes kept the Super Kings' hopes alive, but ultimately, they fell short by 12 runs.

**Notable Performances:** Unmukt Chand (68 off 45 balls), Ali Khan (4/33), Devon Conway (timely boundaries), Calvin Savage (late flurry of boundaries and sixes).

title: “That wasn’t the best…”Unmukt Chand Shares his disappointment on getting dropped from the USA’s World Cup squad
body:
Unmukt Chand opened up on his absence from the USA’s squad for the recently concluded T20 World Cup. Chand Won former India U-19 World Cup winning captain took retirement from Indian cricket in 2021 before moving to the USA for more promising cricket matches. Having played in the inaugural Major League Cricket (MLC) besides other franchised tournaments Chand became eligible to represent the USA. He also indicated readiness to play against India in the T 20 world Cup before being dropped from the squad.

Chand made it known that he was shocked being left out of the T20 World Cup squad, and said he felt as if he were being sucked in.

In his interaction with Cricbuzz Chand said , “That wasn’t the best position to be in, really. Because, for me personally, this was my dream for three years. It was a big shock, clearly. It took me a while to accept it. When you are a player, it is never going to be easy; you have lost everything back home in India and then this one thing that has been your driving force for the last three years just doesn’t come through; so it is tough. I won’t say it just happened. But it wasn’t easy.”

His inner demons were also spoken about by Chand saying that it needed many ups and downs in order to conquer such a feeling

“It was quite an internal battle and basically quite frustrating. It just sucks you in all the time. It would last a day and then disappear and then return again. It hit me in different phases of reality. When you go through that over and over again you automatically become better at it. At some point you will admit that it was not even what happened, that is all about it. Not even considering it anymore,” he added.

Chand is now currently focused on playing Major league cricket for Los Angeles Knight Riders.
summary: Unmukt Chand, a former India U-19 World Cup winning captain, is currently playing for the Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament. He had previously played in the inaugural MLC season and other franchise tournaments, making him eligible to represent the USA in international cricket.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Know where to watch live streaming in India
body:
With the ICC T20 World Cup now over, the much-awaited Major League Cricket 2024, the top-tier domestic T20 competition in the United States, kicks off on Saturday.

The opening match of MLC 2024 between reigning champions MI New York and last season’s finalists Seattle Orcas will be played at Church Street Park in North Carolina. All 25 Major League Cricket T20 matches will be live streamed in India.

The second edition of the USA's premier T20 cricket league will feature six teams.

The first 15 matches of the MLC 2024 will be shared between Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. The final 10 matches, including the four knockout fixtures, will be held exclusively at the Grand Prairie Stadium.

Four of the six MLC teams are owned by franchises of the Indian Premier League (IPL). This includes MI New York (Mumbai Indians), Texas Super Kings (Chennai Super Kings), LA Knight Riders (Kolkata Knight Riders) and the Seattle Orcas (Delhi Capitals). The other two teams are San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom.

MLC 2024 also boasts a galaxy of international cricket stars.

Washington Freedom, coached by Australian great Ricky Ponting, includes powerful Aussie hitters in Glenn Maxwell and Travis Head.

Defending champions MI New York will be led by West Indian powerhouse Kieron Pollard while last year’s runners-up Seattle Orcas will look up to the South African duo of Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock to deliver.

LA Knight Riders will have the services of mystery spinner Sunil Narine of the West Indies while Texas Super Kings and San Francisco Unicorns boast the likes of South African ace Faf du Plessis and New Zealand's Finn Allen, respectively.

The teams will play each other once in the league phase after which the top four sides will progress to the playoffs, which includes IPL-style qualifier and eliminator matches. The MLC 2024 final will be played on July 29.

Where to watch Major League Cricket 2024 live in India

Live streaming of Major League Cricket 2024 will be available on JioCinema. There will be no live telecast of MLC 2024 on any TV channel in India.
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The MLC 2024 tournament begins on Saturday, featuring six teams in the top-tier domestic T20 competition in the United States.
* The tournament will consist of 25 matches, with the first 15 matches split between Church Street Park in North Carolina and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas, and the final 10 matches, including the playoffs, held exclusively at Grand Prairie Stadium.
* The final will be played on July 29.

**Teams and Owners**

* The six teams participating in MLC 2024 are: MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom.
* Four teams are owned by franchises of the Indian Premier League (IPL): MI New York (Mumbai Indians), Texas Super Kings (Chennai Super Kings), LA Knight Riders (Kolkata Knight Riders), and Seattle Orcas (Delhi Capitals).

**International Stars**

* The tournament features a galaxy of international cricket stars, including Kieron Pollard, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Wayne Parnell, Quinton de Kock, Sunil Narine, Faf du Plessis, and Finn Allen.

**Format**

* The teams will play each other once in the league phase, after which the top four teams will progress to the playoffs, featuring IPL-style qualifier and eliminator matches.

**Live Streaming**

* The tournament will be live-streamed in India on JioCinema, with no live telecast on any TV channel.

title: Major League Cricket will launch its second season in DFW Friday
body:
GRAND PRAIRIE, Texas — Downtown Dallas hosted some of the best Cricket players in the country Wednesday ahead of the season's opening games July 5.

The Texas Super Kings will face the Los Angeles Knight Riders at 7:30 p.m. Thursday at Grand Prarie Stadium. In New York, the Seattle Orcas will face MI New York at 3:30 p.m. Eastern Time. The opening matches will kick off (or batt off) the league's second season.

Cognizant Major League Cricket is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the U.S., according to a press release from the league. The sport of Cricket has grown in popularity in the U.S. reflecting changing demographics and increased visibility of the sport.

The sport made its debut in North Texas last year, hosting an "electric" crowd in a sold-out stadium.

Tickets for all matches and playoffs are available here. You can find the full schedule, including what games will be played in Texas, here.
summary: The second season of the Cognizant Major League Cricket, the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the US, is set to begin on July 5. The opening matches will feature the Texas Super Kings vs. the Los Angeles Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium at 7:30 p.m., and the Seattle Orcas vs. MI New York at 3:30 p.m. Eastern Time. Tickets are available for all matches and playoffs, and the full schedule can be accessed online.

title: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Schedule, Teams, Live Streaming, Squads And More
body:
MLC 2024: Major League Cricket (MLC) is a professional T20 cricket league conducted in the United States. The league is operated by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) and is also sanctioned by USA Cricket and officially sanctioned by the International Cricket Council (ICC).

This will be the 2nd season of the Twenty20 cricket league after the inaugural season that took place in July 2023.

MLC 2024 will begin on July 5 (July 6 as per IST) and will be hosted at the following two venues:

Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas

Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina

MI New York won the tournament last year after beating Seattle Orcas by 7 wickets in the MLC 2023 finals which took place on July 31, 2023.

In May 2024, the ICC awarded the Major League Cricket Official List A status, making it only the second associate-run franchise competition to acquire the status from the game's governing body.

This status means that all the records, runs, wickets and stats acquired in the MLC 2024 will now be added to the official records of the format. It also means that MLC is now an official T20 League, much like the IPL or the SA20 or Big Bash League.

American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) which operates the Major League Cricket is backed by Sameer Mehta and Vijay Srinivasan who are the founders of Willow TV, the largest cricket broadcaster in North America, and Satyan Gajwani and Vineet Jain of the Times Group in India.
summary:
**Tournament Overview**
The MLC 2024 is the 2nd season of the professional T20 cricket league in the United States, operated by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) and sanctioned by USA Cricket and the International Cricket Council (ICC).

**Schedule and Venues**
The tournament will begin on July 5, 2024, and will be hosted at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

**Previous Season**
The inaugural season of MLC took place in July 2023, with MI New York winning the tournament by defeating Seattle Orcas by 7 wickets in the finals.

**Official List A Status**
The ICC has granted the MLC Official List A status, making it the second associate-run franchise competition to acquire this status. This means that all records, runs, wickets, and stats acquired in MLC 2024 will be added to the official records of the format, and MLC is now an official T20 League, similar to the IPL or the SA20 or Big Bash League.

**Tournament Operators**
American Cricket Enterprises (ACE), the operator of the MLC, is backed by founders of Willow TV and the Times Group in India.

title: Texas Super Kings vs Los Angeles Knight Riders Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

The first match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas features the hosts, who have the rarity of home advantage in Major League Cricket, the Texas Super Kings, taking on the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

DATE & TIME: Friday 5th July, 2024 - USA ET – 8:30pm / USA PT – 5:30pm / West Indies – 7:30pm & Saturday 6th July, 2024 - UK – 1:30am / South Africa – 2:30am / Pakistan – 5:30am / India – 6:00am / Bangladesh – 6:30am / Australia – 10:30am

VENUE: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, Texas, United States

WEATHER: 30c or 86 F with no rain expected

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

TEXAS SUPER KINGS FORM: EXPLOITING HOME ADVANTAGE

In the inaugural season of Major League Cricket in 2023, the Texas Super Kings finished in the top two of a six-team table but they were eventually beaten in the Challenger by MI New York. However, with a very CSK-influenced leadership group of coach Stephen Fleming and captain Faf du Plessis are expected to come back with a bang in 2024.

LAST THREE: LLWLW

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS FORM: THE RECOVERY OF LAKR

The Los Angeles Knight Riders endured a very difficult first ever season of Major League Cricket as they finished rock-bottom. They begun their season with four successive hammerings before a slender two-wicket defeat of eventual finalists and already league winners Seattle Orcas in their final game and there will need to be a real leap from LAKR this season.

LAST THREE: WLLLL

TEXAS SUPER KINGS BETTING ANALYSIS

The Texas Super Kings will have the benefit of playing at probably the better of the two batting tracks in this tournament, at least that was the case in the ICC T20 World Cup, so there will be pressure on their top order. South Africa captain Aiden Markram didn’t have the best of World Cups with the bat but began to find some touch in the semi-final against Afghanistan and backing him to hit the ground running as TSK’s top batter in this match seems a good bet.

With the ball, TSK are set to try and damage teams with either smart change up bowling from Dwayne Bravo and Marcus Stoinis or spin with Noor Ahmad and Mitchell Santner. The best bet for them, though, to take two or more wickets in this match will be via their point of difference bowler, the excellent Naveen-ul-Haq.

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS BETTING ANALYSIS

Captained by Sunil Narine, LAKR perhaps lack a bit of depth and aggression in their batting lineup right at the top of the order but there is middle-order hitting with the likes of Shakib Al Hasan and Andre Russell. Their biggest threat, though, will be David Miller and, on what should and could be a good batting surface, backing a decent Miller score of 30+ runs seems a good bet.

Bowling-wise, LAKR do have the likes of Adam Zampa, Josh Little and Spencer Johnson to count on but good value could well be found in backing their domestic talents with both Ali Khan and Shadley van Schalkwyk involved. Ali Khan had a strong World Cup and backing him to take two or more of TSZ’s wickets may be worth a shot.

TEXAS SUPER KINGS VS LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS EXPERT PREDICTION

With just two venues in use during the 2024 Major League Cricket season, the Texas Super Kings will effectively be playing ‘home’ games at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas and whilst that seems like a nominal advantage in such a peculiar and short franchise tournament, that factor combined with their well rounded squad and LAKR’s lack of real star quality at the top with either bat or ball, as well as their failure last season, backing the Super Kings looks strong here.
summary:
**Match Details**

* The match is between the Texas Super Kings and the Los Angeles Knight Riders on Friday, July 5, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, United States.
* The weather is expected to be 30°C (86°F) with no rain.

**Team Forms**

* Texas Super Kings finished in the top two in the inaugural season of Major League Cricket in 2023 but lost in the Challenger.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders finished at the bottom of the table in the inaugural season.

**Betting Analysis**

* Texas Super Kings have a well-rounded squad and are expected to perform well at their home ground.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders lack star quality at the top of their batting order.
* Good betting options include Aiden Markram to score well for Texas Super Kings, Naveen-ul-Haq to take two or more wickets, and David Miller to score 30+ runs for Los Angeles Knight Riders.

**Expert Prediction**

* Backing the Texas Super Kings to win the match is a strong prediction due to their home advantage, well-rounded squad, and Los Angeles Knight Riders' lack of star quality and poor performance in the previous season.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Viewing Guide and Match Details
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) has acquired a historic broadcast schedule for its second season, guaranteeing that the competition will be seen by millions of people worldwide.

Throughout the three-week competition, all MLC matches will be aired by Willow by Cricbuzz, the official broadcaster in the USA and Canada, providing unmatched live streaming and on-demand cricket entertainment.

In a calculated attempt to boost accessibility and viewership in the US market, MLC has partnered with several regional sports networks (RSNs) in a new agreement.

Select matches will be aired across these RSNs, starting with YES Network. Each RSN will carry all regular season matches of its home MLC team, bringing cricket to a wider sports market and fostering local support within the teams’ hometowns.

MLC has also confirmed its international broadcast schedule, extending its reach to cricket-loving nations such as Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East, Africa, the United Kingdom, and Ireland.

Teams:

Texas Super Kings

Los Angeles Knight Riders

Seattle Orcas

MI New York

San Francisco Unicorns

Washington Freedom

The opening match on Friday, July 5th, promises to be a thrilling rematch between the 2023 inaugural winners, MI New York, and the Seattle Orcas, taking place in Morrisville, NC. Later that evening, the Texas Super Kings will face off against the LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX, adding to the anticipation and excitement.

MLC has assembled an all-star lineup of announcers, including legendary figures such as Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, Daren Ganga, Pommie Mbangwa, Matthew Hayden, Chris Morris, Natalie Germanos, Scott Stylis, and Mike Haysmen. Their expertise and insights will elevate the viewing experience for fans worldwide.

In addition to the renowned on-air team, MLC will support the development of cricket talent in the United States by welcoming emerging broadcasters Nikhil Uttamchandani, Aaman Patel, and Andrew Leonard (associate cricket expert). Their involvement will provide valuable opportunities for growth and exposure.

Major League Cricket’s broadcast partners:

USA: Willow by Cricbuzz, YES Network and more RSNs to be announced

Canada: Willow by Cricbuzz

Australia and New Zealand: Prime Video

Middle East and North Africa: Cricbuzz

Pakistan: A Sports

Sub-Saharan Africa: ESPN

UK and Ireland: TNT Sports

India: To be announced

Carribean: To be announced

The MLC’s second season is sure to captivate and leave fans across the world in awe, with top-notch cricket matches, knowledgeable commentary, and a dedication to supporting the development of cricket in the United States. The entire experience is further enhanced by the league’s commitment to delivering entertainment off the field, including pyrotechnics, freebies, player encounters, and a lively atmosphere.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* The second season of MLC will take place over three weeks
* The opening match will be played on July 5th between MI New York and Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, NC
* The Texas Super Kings will face off against the LA Knight Riders on the same day at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX

**Broadcast Schedule:**

* Willow by Cricbuzz will be the official broadcaster in the USA and Canada
* MLC has partnered with regional sports networks (RSNs) to air select matches, starting with YES Network
* International broadcast partners include Prime Video (Australia and New Zealand), Cricbuzz (Middle East and North Africa), A Sports (Pakistan), ESPN (Sub-Saharan Africa), TNT Sports (UK and Ireland), and more to be announced (India and Caribbean)

**Teams:**

* There are six teams participating in the tournament: Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom

**Commentary Team:**

* MLC has assembled an all-star lineup of announcers, including legendary figures like Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, and Matthew Hayden, as well as emerging broadcasters Nikhil Uttamchandani, Aaman Patel, and Andrew Leonard

**Tournament Experience:**

* The league promises to deliver entertainment off the field, including pyrotechnics, freebies, player encounters, and a lively atmosphere

title: Willow by Cricbuzz offers free MLC matches
body:
Willow by Cricbuzz, the cricket streaming service, has announced broadcasting plans for the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) season. Cricket fans across North America can look forward to live MLC matches on Willow by Cricbuzz and their regional sports network, in addition to special free-to-view broadcasts on Sunday nights.

In addition to airing all MLC matches on Willow by Cricbuzz, the company has partnered with various regional sports networks to bring regular season matches to local markets.

Partnered Regional Sports Networks Include:

· Monumental Sports Network (DC Freedom)

· YES Network (MI New York)

· ROOT SPORTS (Seattle Orcas)

· Bally Sports Southwest (Texas Super Kings)

· Bally Sports SoCal (LA Knight Riders)

Three Sunday night matches on July 7th, 14th and 21st will be available for free viewing on Willow by Cricbuzz, Sling Freestream, and Fubo TV, providing access for fans nationwide, all at no cost.

Free Sunday Night Matches Schedule:

· July 7: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs. San Francisco Unicorns at 8:30 PM EDT

· July 14: MI New York vs. Texas Super Kings at 8:30 PM EDT

· July 21: MI New York vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders at 8:30 PM EDT

“Riding the momentum from the USA’s unforgettable T20 World Cup run, Major League Cricket is poised for a spectacular future,” said Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “Our partnerships with regional sports networks provide fans unprecedented access to watch their favorite World Cup players on local teams, critically weaving the sport into the fabric of local communities. The addition of free Sunday night viewings also broadens access, energizing a vibrant and rising fan community eager to support their hometown heroes. This is the beginning of a new chapter in North American cricket, with boundless growth potential.”

* Willow by Cricbuzz has announced its broadcasting plans for the 2024 MLC season, which will include live matches on their platform and regional sports networks.
* The company has partnered with several regional sports networks to air regular season matches, including Monumental Sports Network, YES Network, ROOT SPORTS, Bally Sports Southwest, and Bally Sports SoCal.
* Three Sunday night matches on July 7th, 14th, and 21st will be available for free viewing on Willow by Cricbuzz, Sling Freestream, and Fubo TV.
* The free Sunday night matches schedule includes:
	+ July 7: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs. San Francisco Unicorns
	+ July 14: MI New York vs. Texas Super Kings
	+ July 21: MI New York vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders
* The CEO of Willow by Cricbuzz, Todd Myers, is optimistic about the growth of cricket in North America, citing the momentum from the USA's T20 World Cup run and the potential for local communities to support their hometown heroes.

title: Major League Cricket launched its second season in Downtown Dallas with captains and fans
body:

MLC’s USA players Nitish Kumar, Shadley van Schalkwyk (LA Knight Riders), Jahmar Hamilton, Sanjay Krishnamurthi (San Francisco Unicorns), Miland Kumar, and Josh Tromp were also part of the excitement.
